Greetings, follower of Elatt. May your journeys be safe!
Well, well. The new Champion of the Holy Mission. What brings you here?
What do you need, follower of Elatt?
"Demands"? Oh wonderful. I have angry tribesmen lining up to join our armies, how do you want me to tell them they can't have their revenge? They'll need a show of force to make them back off.
I suppose that might be enough to remind them of their duty. I’ll make it work somehow.
(Give Horror Chitin) Remind them that Elatt's sacrifice is the only reason the scourge hasn't killed us all.
(If you had such a thing, it would surely convince her.)
Oh wow, did you do this? It's a very impressive trophy... I think this might work.
(Offer her your Coralhorn Bow) Then force them to see reason if you have to.
With a weapon like that? I think I might be able to.
I'll get to work on my end. I'll make this truce happen if it's the last thing I do.
I can't do the impossible. Unless you have something to remind them of their duty, or something I can use to force them to see reason, I can't do a damn thing.

Maybe if you could bring me a trophy from a powerful Scourge Beast, or an exceptionally crafted bow from an Alpha Coralhorn, it might be enough of a show of force that I’ll be able to get through to them.
It’s good to finally have peace again. Now I can focus on bringing in wild game and not on drilling troops!
Ugh... I’m really not enjoying this whole Chamberlady thing. Elatt’s name, I need a drink.
Well well, [PlayerName] the Champion of Elatt. This is a surprise meeting. Here to finally pledge your aid in slaughtering those desert rats?
Well, Elatt's newest Templar. What do you want [PlayerName]? Here to finally pledge your aid in slaughtering those desert rats?
Well, that's too bad for him. We aren't going to stop fighting a war that we're finally winning. No force on Aurai will make me change my mind!
You already have my word that I’ll pull back my armies. The message is already being sent to my warriors.
Bah, it’s not fair when Elatt gives you his strength on top of your own! Fine! You win. I’ll call off my armies. I’m smart enough to know when I’m whupped.
No? Fine. Then leave me alone. I have plans for Levant’s destruction to create!
Someone from the Holy Mission! Elatt be praised! There's a coup happening right now in Levant! Almost the entire army has taken control of the city and are besieging the Palace as we speak!

Levant’s been closed off! I only managed to leave because they didn’t guard the Undercity Passage. It’s to the south of the city, at the bottom of the cliff. It leads straight into town but it’s full of smugglers and corsairs.
Anything else you can tell me about that passage?
Yes. That passage has an entrance to the Palace as well, but it needs a key. If you want to reach the King and Queen, you'll need to find one. Most of her soldiers should have a copy by now.
What other news can you tell me?
Levant is in the middle of a desperate famine, so everyone is starving. Many would do anything for some Travel Rations to fill their bellies.
Under the order of Temporary Regent Cyrene, all access to and from the Kingdom of Levant is suspended. Violators will be shot.
Hey, you. Mind getting me out of this death pit? My people need me.
Who are you, really?

Just someone who cares deeply about the fate of the tribes of Old Levant, it's why those rats squatting in their shiny "Heroic Kingdom" locked me up in here. I didn't do anything that they wouldn't have done.
I can offer you something interesting in exchange for my freedom, traveller. A key that opens a secret entrance to the Palace in Levant.

There's a smuggler's tunnel under the city of New Levant that connects the desert to the slums. Further along is a passage that leads to the Palace itself, or so I hear. With this key, you can get inside from there.
Why should I let a criminal out of here?
What were you intending to do with that?
What would I do with something like that?
I'll get you out. Stand back while I break the lock.
I'm not going to let you out.
Criminal's a nasty word. I prefer to be called a freedom fighter.
I hadn't decided yet. But something like this is always useful, wouldn't you say?
None of my business, traveller. You do what you want with it.
Old Levant owes you a great debt, traveller. Should we ever return to power in Abrassar, I will gladly reward you with riches and power. Now, get me out of this place!
Fine. Then at least leave here, so I can face my fate with dignity!
Come to gloat, Levantin? Get out of here, and let me face my fate with dignity.
A follower of Elatt? How did you get in here? The gates are locked!
Elatt demands peace. Now, let me see the king and queen, or risk his fury.
Are you... are you threatening me,?
Elatt is. He wants peace and he wants it NOW. Do you want to be the one to deny a god?

Point taken. Here. Take this key. It will open the rear entrance to the Palace from the smuggler's tunnel. If I were you, I’d watch out. Someone will likely have seen our little chat and will have sent reinforcements there.
(Give 3 travel rations) There's a famine going on here, isn't there? I have some travel rations that will fill your belly.
Dammit, I've been living on one meal a day for weeks. Why do you tempt me like this? What do you want?
Elatt wants peace. I want to see your king and queen. Show me how to reach them, and this food is yours.
Augh... I'll do it. Here, take this key. There's a rear entrance to the Palace in the smuggler's tunnel in the slums. It's well guarded, so go armed if you want to live.
Now, let’s pretend we never had this discussion. I have no interest in meeting a firing squad up close.
Move along. Martial law is in effect. Do not cause trouble. Go about your business!
I'm just a merc, but I still can't let you in. There’s people who fled the city who went to hide near the oasis, I think. They’ll be more inclined to chat with you than I am.
[PlayerName]? What in Elatt's name are you doing here?

Oh, he "demands" peace, does he? Does he have any idea how we've suffered at the hands of the Blue Chamber? No, we'll make peace when we're good and ready to. Until then, Cyrene controls this kingdom!
What have you done to King Simeon and Queen Calixa?
Yzan, are you seriously going to let this happen? I thought you believed in the ideals of Levant!

I still do. It's Calixa and Simeon who lost sight of them. The Blue Chamber tried to starve us all to death! Sagard Battleborn ignored the way of the Blue Chamber Collective and took no prisoners! How could we negotiate peace with them?
Surely you’ve seen all that the Holy Mission has done to end this conflict! We aren't your enemy.
The lives of our people were threatened. All we ever did was defend ourselves! Why should we crawl to our enemies and beg them to forgive us?
The Blue Chamber is willing to negotiate, even after Levant burned and pillaged their villages. This is proof they're willing to accept a fair peace.
What? I find it hard to believe that they'd actually be willing to negotiate. What motive could they have to pursue a fair peace when they could demand our surrender?
Levant attacked them first! You attacked Berg, and you killed one of our Champions! You are the ones who started this disaster!

Only to defend ourselves from Old Levant's absurd demand that they control the entire region. It would have been the end of Levant. And even then, it was only a rogue offshoot of our army that led that attack, and yet the whole of Levant was punished for it!
Because all the Blue Chamber Collective did was try to defend itself. How many people were killed by Levant's armies?
Yeah? If their strategy to starve us all to death had succeeded, even more would have died! We had to pillage every village we attacked just to survive!
Elatt will ensure they do not take advantage of you. He knows it would only lead to more war. The god of discipline plays no favourites.
You're asking me to abandon everything in hopes that a faction outside our control can make a fair peace with a dying queen and an injured king! How could you expect that of us?
We will have peace, one way or another. Stand aside. I'm here to speak to the actual rulers of The Heroic Kingdom.
If he does not recognize Cyrene as the new Queen of Levant, then we do not recognize Elatt's power over Abrassar. We have no need of gods to tell us what to do.
I won't let the Blue Chamber take advantage of Levant. I suffered under them too, remember? You can trust me.
You think I've forgotten how you mugged me, you rat?! Why in Elatt's name should I trust you?!
I want to trust you... But what you're asking if far beyond either of us. The entire kingdom is at stake!
Open your eyes! You're pitting Levant against a foe you can't possibly beat! Peace is your only chance for survival!
I’ll take that chance. To make peace now would be to surrender to them! How can we trust them after all they've done to us?
So regicide, betrayal and brutal crackdowns on your poorest citizens are the true ideals of Levant?
It's what the damned Blues pushed us to! We never wanted any of this!
You left Cierzo because of how they forced Roland's problems onto you. You're doing that same exact thing to Levant right now!
I... No, you can't say what we're doing is the same! I'm just... I'm trying to protect them! I don't... Damn you, [PlayerName]!
Damn your sharp words. Damn you for making me doubt everything I've sacrificed for. Cyrene... I can't continue what we started. If you want to kill [PlayerName], you'll have to do it yourself.
Enough lies! Levant is my home, and I will not let it continue to be destroyed! I will fight for it. I would die for it! And if I must kill you for it, then so be it!
I don't believe we will meet again, [PlayerName]. I'm not hanging around to be tried for treason...

We triumphed over our tyrants, that's what. They were ready make peace with our foes after so many of our soldiers were slaughtered. I can't stand by and allow that to happen. We have sacrificed too many lives for this to end peacefully!
I am the new queen of Levant now. Calixa is dying of a poison that has no cure, and Simeon is beaten and broken. I'll line the bastard up for the firing squad myself!
... You're the woman with the shield on her back. You shot Zephyrien with that poisoned bullet, didn't you?

It was nothing personal. Old Levant was demanding to claim Abrassar from us, and there was no doubt in my mind that the Blue Chamber would accept their demands. Our kingdom and ideals would have been destroyed.
Sirroco would only offer to help us stop them if we killed Zephyrien and gave them half of the land we took in the war. It was an easy choice. One life for the lives of my entire people.
What could he have done to deserve a death that cruel?!
I don't know and I don't care. Sirocco's reasons are none of my business.
Enough talk. I don't care if Elatt "demands" peace. He has no power here. Now leave and take that message to him, or you can join Simeon at the firing squad!
Yzan, you spineless coward! If you won’t fight for your Queen and country, then you are worthless to me! I’ll see you both shot for this!
... Gah... Elatt damn it all. Am I really so vulnerable without my wife to watch my back? Having to have my kingdom be saved by one of Elatt’s people... It’s beyond embarrassing.
Are you going to make it, sire?
Forget me, a few flesh wounds are barely enough to slow me down! Calixa’s the one who needs help. Cyrene shot her with something, I think she said it was poisoned!
...That was Elatt, wasn't it? He makes a very compelling argument. Fine, we'll set off for Monsoon as soon as humanly possible. But he'd better hold up his end of the deal!
We’ll be along as soon as we can. The moment Levant is stable, we’ll be on our way.
Ah! The latest Champion of the Holy Mission! I’d welcome you with drinks and stories, but things are not well in the Heroic Kingdom.
I’m afraid I don't have time for you. We’re juggling a famine and a losing war!
Can we get on with this already? My wife’s life is hanging in the balance!
I don’t know if I’ll ever get used to this. Having Calixa speak to me like this is... beyond strange.
You will always have a place at our table, [PlayerName]. I will never forget what you did for Calixa and me.

(She breathes with difficulty... Her body is numb and paralyzed from the poison. Her armor somewhat softened the blow, but the bullet still pierced her skin. Elatt's power is keeping her alive, but just barely.)
So, what do I need to do? How does this work?
You need to use a giant source of Mana to kill me, and I just have to survive it. Well, it's not like I have anything left to lose. Let’s do it.
(You hear king Simeon groaning. He seems to be conscious again.)
(A sudden wave of heat floods through your veins. Elatt's anger is palpable.)
They have brought their petty war to our city. They have spilled blood on our soil and wish to drag us into war on their behalf. No more!
[PlayerName], I must rely on you once more. I will speak with Cardinal Bourlamaque and prepare a plan to settle this senseless conflict. Return to him as soon as possible.
(An invisible force shakes you from head to toe, and Elatt's voice comes like a gust of hot wind)
[PlayerName], things go poorly in Abrassar. My messengers have been imprisoned. Civil war strikes the city of Levant. You are needed there, desperately.
Isn't Soeran closer than I am?
No, he is not. He is standing between both armies, trying to stop any further combat between either side. This task is up to you.
(Elatt's fury erupts as potent as a volcano within you, then suddenly becomes calm. Elatt speaks to you and Simeon in your minds)
Simeon, bring Calixa to Monsoon. Accept terms of peace, and I will see to it that her life is saved. Until then, I will use what strength I can spare to keep her alive.
[PlayerName], return to Monsoon with all possible haste. We must have a strong front ready to oversee negotiations between these foolish nations. Nothing must be left to chance.
Good, everyone needed for the Ascension is present.
Your body is beyond saving. Your spirit, however, is another story. The keys to divinity are an unyielding will in the face of certain death, and the full power of a Ley Line to fuel the spell.
I will divert Mana from across the Hallowed Marsh and temporarily create a new Ley Line under Monsoon. From you, Calixa, I will need your iron will.

The spell that led me to godhood was designed to destroy the entirety of my being. Only by resisting the spell and refusing to die was I able to survive it and be transformed. I will need you to show the same self-discipline and force of will.
I can guide you through the process and help you understand what to do, but ultimately, only you can transcend your own mortal flesh, Queen Calixa. Brace yourself.
Didn’t the spell cause the Scourge when you survived it, though? We can't do that again, in the middle of Monsoon! It would be a catastrophe!
Do you have a way to deal with the consequences of the spell, Elatt? How can we prevent another Scourge from happening?

Fear not. I have planned for this danger. Those of you who have reached the rank of Disciple, I call upon your aid. You are trained to absorb and destroy Corruption. I ask of you to join in my spell and dive your spirits into Calixa's.

I ask you to be a human barrier to contain the Corruption that the Ascension will unleash. But know that to take on such a task is to choose death. If the Corruption does not kill you now, then it will in a scant few weeks.
I cannot force you to give your lives, so I ask that you give them willingly. Will seven of you give your lives so that Calixa will Ascend without bringing further ruin to Aurai?
I want to help. Let me take Ellinara's place.
[PlayerName], if you do this, know that you will perish. Even if you survive the initial task, you will have at most a month to live.
I understand. I'm still sure I want to do this.
You are certain? You have much of your life ahead of you. You will truly take on this certain doom? You choose to willingly give up your life?
Yes. I'm willing to sacrifice myself to contain the Corruption and spare Ellinara.
You are committed now, [PlayerName]. Join the circle and brace yourself.
(As you center your focus into Calixa, you feel Elatt's power fill you with great warmth. Then, for a brief painful moment you feel yourself torn from your very body, your spirit plunging into her.)
What do you want me to do, Elatt?
You, as a Champion, should be on the front lines of the defense.
I need you to join the defense of Monsoon, Templar.
Go forth and protect Monsoon with your life. Do not let a single Scourge Beast reach the temple! The safety of the city is in your hands.
If Calixa’s Ascension is necessary and our deaths can prevent a second Scourge, I'm willing to sacrifice my life.
You didn't have to do this for me, [PlayerName]. But if you insist... then I thank you. I will not forget your sacrifice on my behalf.
[PlayerName], you're awake. Good. You have some time left in this world after all. How do you feel?
Not all that terrible, considering. I still feel stronger than I ever have.

[PlayerName], the light of the Ascension is a balm against the Corruption, but it is not a cure. With every passing day, the Corruption will eat away at you. Should you fall now, you will surely not survive.

You likely only have about a month before you truly stand at death's door. Make good use of the final days you have left to live. Set your affairs to rest as best you can, so you may pass without regrets.
Well, I knew what I was getting into...
Indeed you did. And I thank you for it.
Oh crap. This was a bad idea.
Doesn't Elatt always tell you? Never do anything that you do not understand. Because now you live with the consequences of your rash action.
The others were able to protect Monsoon from the Scourge attack. There were very few casualties.
You have done your service to Aurai. Now, you are free to do with your remaining life what you wish. Live it well, and meet your ancestors with pride, [PlayerName].
Not to mention that the Holy Mission has been dragging out the preparations for negotiations for far too long! We should have started days ago!
Forgive us for any delay on our end. One of our tribes has turned against us all. I fear they plan to begin a civil war, armed with a small army of ghosts and undead. Precautions had to be taken.
Enough! Do not escalate this conflict further! The weapons shall be shared. Any who would use them to restart the conflict will have to answer to Elatt’s judgment.
By “beasts” do you mean your own people? Perhaps a few less firearms in the hands of fools will make keeping order a little easier!

How can you promise that when you can’t even keep order in your own city? I heard that one of your own people was captured, then was arrested and detained unlawfully in an illegal prison outside Monsoon! Consider me very skeptical, Cardinal!

I must express concern about introducing further religious uncertainty. I’ve been informed that there was a small massacre of “heretics” here recently. To suddenly introduce a new goddess now would only inflame further strife!
That tragedy was dealt with as best that humankind is capable. We may falter, but despite our failings, we would die to protect the people of both your factions.
My people demand repayment for the many destroyed lives and homes. To agree to terms this unfavorable would tear the Blue Chamber Collective apart. I cannot agree to them in good faith.
If repayment for lost homes and lives is what is needed to secure peace, then the Holy Mission will cover the cost. We understand that compromise is needed.
Very well. The Blue Chamber Collective accepts these terms of peace.
[PlayerName], you have done much to aid in securing this peace. Come, drink the Peacemaker's Elixir with us.
[PlayerName], I have watched you grow and strive ever since you came to us. Though your actions often went unrecognized, rest assured that I have seen them. Your deeds deserve additional reward.
All of you who serve the Holy Mission, come to my altar in the temple. I have need of you all.
We have been summoned to the Temple. I will see you at Elatt’s Altar, [PlayerName].
(The Cardinal does not respond... His spirit is currently battling the Corruption within Calixa as the Ascension ritual progresses.)
At long last the war pushes back, far from our borders. It is a good time to earn some gratitude from the Blue Chamber now that their victory is assured.
If you’re looking for those Levantin agents we arrested, they’re gone. They left this morning. I can assure you that I haven’t the slightest idea where they may be.
We both know that’s a lie. You had them locked up in an old cellar in the swamp!
What an absurd accusation. I released them! If they happened to be captured by the Blue Chamber moments after being set free, that’s their fault, not mine.
Another god... Has no one learned the lesson the first time?! Mark my words, our descendants will be pawns in their power games over Aurai. Mark my words.
Can’t talk for now, [PlayerName]. Ellinara has me running around coordinating our people. There’s a lot we need to do to be ready for the peace talks.
I will not allow violence on our watch. These talks will go through and we will have peace again!
I’m glad you were at my side back there, [PlayerName]. I don’t know if I’d still be here without your efforts.
Either way, thank you for walking this path with me. You’re a true friend, [PlayerName]. No, more like family, after all we’ve done.
I still can’t believe you went and did it. Even at my most dedicated, I’d have shied away from sacrificing my life, and yet you did it without a second thought.
I’m... going to miss you, [PlayerName]. I won’t let anyone forget what you did for all of us.
You’re still here, I see. You still choose to linger here between life and death, [PlayerName]? Why have you not gone to your well-deserved rest?
I’m not ready let go just yet.
Perhaps I can lay your concerns to rest, then. Or at least, I can keep you company until you are ready to move on and meet your ancestors.
I want to ask about places I’ve been.
I want to ask about people I care for.
I want to ask about you.
Thank you for talking with me, Elatt.

Rissa is doing well enough. She is preparing to retire from her duties, and has picked a new successor for her as Chamberlady of Cierzo. Gabriella Sullivan’s niece should make for a good Chamberlady after a few years of training.

Rissa has retired as Chamberlady. The loss of Cierzo hurt her deeply. I don’t know if it will ever be rebuilt after what happened. She wishes you had chosen to become part of her family, but accepts that you did what was right for Aurai.

Oliele is doing well. She has committed to the philosopher’s path of the Holy Mission. If she continues her work at her current pace, she will likely be ready to become a Disciple in less than two years. She misses you, but does not grieve.

Oliele... She fights the Scourge at the Gates of Catharsis now. She is vicious and relentless in her work, and has gained the admiration of many. But her life will remain a violent one until she will finally be overcome by her foes.

Yzan... Hmm... Ah, there he is. He sails the sea near Oroshi. He has made his peace with no longer having a home, and has returned to his merchant ways. He will be alright, I think. He regrets his actions, but is determined to do better in the future.

... It pains me to say this. Yzan refuses to move on. His ghost lingers in Abrassar desert, craving a home. He curses your name, Levant itself, and all who caused his situation, save himself. I doubt he will ever rest in peace.

Elinara remains thankful for your sacrifice in her place. She has redoubled her efforts to preserve the joy and peace of everyone in Monsoon. I have no doubt that she will live enough for both of you.

Cierzo is as lively as ever. Your old home in the Lighthouse has found a new family, and your story is told to the children at bedtime. I think you can rest easy knowing that you’ve become a local legend to them.

Cierzo remains destroyed. I doubt it will ever be rebuilt. You can rest at peace knowing that the ones who destroyed it have since turned on one another and none remain alive. Justice has, in some small way, been served.
Berg has changed for the better. Sagard Battleborn has handed his role as Chamberlord to Gabriella Sullivan, who is ruling it very fairly. I forsee great things in Berg’s future.

Berg remains in a state of chaotic flux. Gabriella Sullivan remains a good Chamberlady, but Sagard and his rogue troops continue to cause trouble. It may be some time before peace truly returns to Enmerkar.
Levant is greater than I could have ever dreamed. Calixa was a fine choice for goddess, and continues to uplift her city. I thank you for helping her ascend, [PlayerName].

Levant is still dealing with difficulties. While things have greatly improved, the brutal conspiracy that took the life of the younger prince left bad blood in many minds. It may be years before the city truly benefits from Calixa’s new role.
Monsoon is doing well. Your deeds are remembered fondly, [PlayerName]. Many new missionaries have joined, hoping to one day be considered your equal. You can rest easy and proud.

Monsoon is well enough. Immaculates still cause trouble from time to time, and people have once again gone missing in the Marsh... but overall, things are better than they were. You are missed here, [PlayerName].

I am proud of what you’ve accomplished, you know. When you first stood before me and swore to work with me for the sake of Aurai, I knew you had great potential, but you surpassed my hopes considerably.
Your willingness to volunteer for that final task, even when it was not required of you, was impressive. I will not forget it, [PlayerName]. You’ve left behind quite an impressive legacy.

I still seek a way to put an end to the Scourge forever, and I do foresee several groups with their own plans to do so. All I can do is trust that together, we can find a way. If the last century has proven anything, it’s that humanity is resilient.
You are welcome, [PlayerName]. It is the least I can do.
I will remain here if you wish for more company, until you are ready to let go of this life and move on to the next. Take the time you need.
Why would Old Levant make a claim to the region now? They’ve rejected our open door for years on end... This must be connected to my son’s murder. It has to be. The timing is too convenient.
Oh, [PlayerName]. Cyrene was looking for you out in front of the palace. She said it was important.
Kirouac told me what you did for him. I’ve informed Cyrene that you should be well rewarded.
Now, to figure out who could have infiltrated us and sparked this war. The Sand Corsairs? Old Levant causing a false flag attack? People within the Blue Chamber itself? Gah, we need more leads.

Calixa’s worrying too much. Kirouac will make sure that Old Levant doesn't get the better of us at the council meeting. He’s good at politics. And even if the Council sides with Old Levant... I’d like to see them even try to kick us out of here.
So, you’re the one who saved Kirouac, huh? You’re tougher than I thought. I'm glad you're on our side!

Our main concern should be tracking down our son’s killer. I heard it was a missionary from the Holy Mission, but I seriously doubt that. If Elatt wanted us out of Abrassar, he’d handle it with words and not murder.
[PlayerName], right? I’ve got some work for you. I need you to run bodyguard duty for one of our ambassadors, Kirouac. He’s on a diplomatic mission to the city of Berg, in Enmerkar.
The Blue Chamber Collective is set to meet, and one of the issues being discussed could strike a fatal blow to our kingdom if it goes poorly. We need to make sure that doesn’t happen.
What’s the issue?
Skip the details and just tell me what I need to do.

I’ll try to keep this brief. Abrassar used to be a lush and fertile region with several powerful tribes living here. Then the Scourge happened. Between every major river being diverted, and the Scourge swarming the region, well... Look outside, you can see the results.

To make things worse, one of the beasts that attacked the desert grew to near-gigantic size. The Devourer, we called it. The old tribes that lived here before us abandoned the region in fear of the thing.

It was only about 24 years ago when Calixa and Simeon led an army into the desert to retake it. I was just a fresh recruit at the time. It was an impossible feat, but we managed to bring down the Devourer, and then purge Abrassar of the rest of the Scourge.

Elatt, the god of discipline himself, granted the Abrassar desert to Simeon and Calixa to rule as a reward. As such, the Heroic Kingdom has operated outside the Blue Chamber's laws since the beginning.

The old tribes that fled the region have a problem with that. Now that the region is safe enough to live in, they want control of it again. They refuse to recognize both Elatt's decision and the Royal Family's rule. They've been attacking our scouts and soldiers for years now.
Since force failed, they've switched to demanding the Blue Chamber overturn Elatt's decision and return the region to their control. If they get their way, we'll be thrown out.
The old tribes of Abrassar are claiming that the region belongs to them, and that our Kingdom has no right to rule. If this meeting goes badly, Old Levant may overthrow us completely.
I can’t let that happen. What can I do to help?
I’m busy with something right now. I’ll come back later if I need the money.
We've sent Kirouac to Berg to attend the Council Meeting and hopefully appeal to the sanity of the Collective. If you're among his protectors, I'll sleep better at night.

I need you to journey to Enmerkar Forest, get to Berg, and make sure nothing happens to Kirouac while you're there. You'll find him in the biggest building in the north of the city, the Blue Chamber itself.
Now, I have to be off. I have to go check on my informants to see if any new information has come in.
Well, looks like you made it, [PlayerName]. Good to see you.
Cyrene? What are you doing here?
One of our agents intercepted information that Old Levant has a major plot in motion here today. Given the circumstances, I had to come in person, just in case.
So what's the plan?

Keep an ear out for trouble. See that man over there by the stairs? He's the one who brought me this information. If there's anything you can do to make sure Old Levant's claims are crushed, help him with it.
Oy, you! [PlayerName]! I need a report on what happened in Berg!
Cyrene, where were you?! Someone attacked the Blue Chamber mid-session!

I know. One of my agents tipped me off before the attack, and I tried to intercept their leader. It was a trap. I barely got out with my life. And to make matters worse, I've been framed for ordering the murder of Old Levant’s ambassador!
The Blue Chamber has put a bounty on my head, and has already sent us a declaration of war because of this mess.
They think I'm responsible for the attack as well. Whoever organized this was a professional.
Someone went to a lot of trouble to make it look like Levant is responsible for all this.
Even though I almost prevented the entire attack? It’s clear that Levant is not responsible!
You too? Our enemy is very thorough indeed. It might not be safe to return to Berg until the war has ended.
There’s people in the Blue Chamber Collective who have wanted to “put us in our place” for a long time now. I’m not surprised they’re being unreasonable. They could even be behind the attack...
I managed to save Kirouac from the attackers. He's shaken, but he's alright.
Yes, he got back here shortly before you did. You did a good job rescuing him, [PlayerName].
I was able to find the attacker's base of operations. The people inside seem to have been soldiers from Levant. We may have been infiltrated.
I found the leader of the attack at his hidden camp in Enmerkar. He was definitely one of our commanders. We've been infiltrated for sure.
Elatt damn it all. I'm getting to the bottom of this! Could Old Levant have planned so far ahead? Do they have help from outside Abrassar? I have nothing but questions!
You did good work out there, [PlayerName]. Here, your payment.
You're far craftier than you look, [PlayerName]. You were a great help out there. Here, your pay with a small bonus on top.
I have to take stock of the situation. Come back in a few days and I'm sure I'll have another assignment for you. The desert rumbles with the sound of war…

[PlayerName], you’re back already? We have a major problem. Someone attacked the Council meeting in Berg, and Kirouac has been kidnapped. As far as we know, it’s possible he was taken somewhere in the South of Enmerkar Forest. Please, bring him back safely!
I don’t have any work for you yet, [PlayerName]. Check back in a few days. In the meantime, take your time getting used to life in Abrassar. It’s a dangerous region.
Wait, what do you mean the murder of Old Levant’s ambassador?

Their ambassador was found strangled in her bed after the declaration of war was made. The Chamberlords are accusing Levant of planning the attempted bombing and me for the murder! I wasn’t even in Berg that night!

You're one of the mercenaries Cyrene hired, right? Listen, I have some juicy information. Old Levant claims there's something in the archives that will convince the rest of the Chamberlords in a heartbeat.
I think our best chance at preventing that from happening is to get in there and find the information first! If we know what to expect, we can counter their point before they even make it.
And how do you plan on getting in without anyone noticing?

The only one watching the place is that Holy Mission Champion, and I can see him leaving to take care of something outside the city as we speak. No one will notice us if we poke around the archives and get a head start.
What do you mean "we"? This sounds like a terrible idea. I'm not going to be part of this.
And here I thought you actually cared about Levant. Fine, I'll go by myself, then. If you're not going to help, then get out of our way. Why don’t you just get yourself a drink at the inn, on me.
Alright, I'm in. What's the plan?

There's some stairs that lead down below, behind the central platform. Head down there, try not to attract too much attention, and I'll meet you there in a bit. It'll look too suspicious if we both go at the same time.
What are you looking at? I'm here on behalf of the Kingdom of Levant to protect our ambassador.
Oh, good, the patsy's here. Shank him and light the fuse!
(The sound of an explosion rocks the air and makes the ground tremble beneath your feet. It came from the Blue Chamber! Kirouac might be in terrible danger!)

"Remember, the bomb must be blown at precisely the time that the miners signal from the other side of the tunnel. If not, the troops hiding in the Ancient Burial Ground ruins will not be able to launch the attack."
"If the plan goes well, don't forget that warriors from Berg may swarm the burial ground. Just be absolutely sure to burn this note, Paul."
You! You’re from Levant, right? What in Elatt’s name is the meaning of this?
You tell me! I just stepped outside for a breath of air and I heard an explosion!

Mercenaries attacked the Council meeting. They shot the ambassador from Old Levant, and then took hostages into the Archives below the Blue Chamber. I think they took your Ambassador Kirouac too. You might want to follow them if you want to save him..
I’m getting to the bottom of this. I’m going after them.
They took Kirouac? Dammit, there goes my payday!
I hope you find these attackers, Levantin. Everything points to your kingdom executing the attack. I would rather avoid being dragged into open war.
You’re [PlayerName], right? Rissa told me about you. Just behave yourself and we won’t have a problem.
How goes the search?
I’m still looking for Kirouac.

Have you searched the tunnel the attackers used to get under Berg? If he’s not there, it’s possible they took him to an outpost somewhere. I remember hearing about suspicious people gathering at a cabin somewhere in the south…It could be a lead.
Have you seen Cyrene since the attack?
Cyrene has a bounty for her arrest. We believe she ordered the assassination of Old Levant’s ambassador. If the woman had any sense she’d have run back to Levant by now.
Oh thank the winds, rescue! Thanks for coming!
Kirouac! What happened?
I don't know. There was an explosion, and then thugs armed to the teeth came pouring out from under the Blue Chamber. They shot the Old Levant ambassador and then grabbed me and stuffed me in a sack!

Someone's trying to frame us for killing Old Levant’s Ambassador, I’m sure of it. There's no way Calixa or Simeon would have authorized something like this. We need to do something before the Blue Chamber takes this as an act of war!
I can get back to Berg from here. I need to try to smooth this over before it’s too late!
I’m sure the one who organized the attack is still out there.
Whoever organized this must be long gone by now…
Investigate further if you feel you need to. As soon as you’re done though, report back to Cyrene in Levant. I get the feeling Enmerkar might not be safe for any of us…
That was too much excitement for one lifetime. I'm not going anywhere outside this city ever again, mark my words!
Did you manage to convince the Chamberlords that we aren't responsible for the attack?
I was barely able to get my entourage out of Berg before they declared war on us. There was nothing I could do.
Hey, [PlayerName], I think Cyrene’s gone. We need her here in case something happens. Can you check Berg’s Inn real quick for her?
Oh, hello, [PlayerName]. How are you doing?

The doors of the Heroic Kingdom are open to them. They’re welcome to come join us! And yet they spit in our outstretched hand again and again. I don’t understand why they cling to the ghost of their past pride.
I heard a fight coming from under the Blue Chamber! What happened?
There were some mercenaries down there with a bomb. I managed to stop them.

Oh Elatt’s breath, this is the last thing we need. This could cause a major diplomatic incident! Alright, you go and try to track down where they came from, I’ll try to handle the diplomatic side of things.
If you don’t have any leads, double check downstairs for evidence, in case you missed something.
Halt right there, [PlayerName]! We saw you go into the archives shortly before it exploded and mercenaries from Levant came charging out! You’re coming with us!
It wasn’t me! They’re just using me as a puppet!
Wait, what do you mean mercenaries from Levant came charging out?!
Wait, wait, bring Rissa over here, I’m sure we can work something out!

Don’t play dumb with us! After the bomb went off, those mercenaries kidnapped Rissa and ambassador Kirouac, and took off with them to somewhere to the South of the forest! Tell me where their hideout is and maybe I won’t hurt you!
Wait, Rissa’s been taken too?!
Enough of this! Get down on your knees, criminal! You’re coming with us! Do not resist!
(Run away) I’m getting out of here!
Hey! HEY! HALT! Get back here, you Levantin scum!

How’ve you been, [PlayerName]? My crew and I are working on protecting travelers coming and going from the city. I want to tackle larger threats, but the rest of my people assure me that the animals here in Abrassar need to be treated with fear and respect.
Maybe at some point we’ll be enough to clear out the old Sand Rose mine, or the Assassin Bug hive, but until then we’ll have to take what jobs we can.
[PlayerName], good timing, I have work for you. The war is going well, but Levant itself is facing a crisis.
Our situation is getting desperate. The war has cut us off from our usual trade routes, and the few that remain are being plundered by bandits. If things don't change soon, we’ll face a famine!

The worst are the "Sand Corsairs", as they call themselves. They make no demands, refuse all negotiations, and leave no survivors in their raids. Then even ransacked one of our cactus farms yesterday!

Our troops can at least resupply in the field by looting and pillaging the land they take. Our city is not so lucky. If these Sand Corsairs are not dealt with, we may win the war only to come home to a city of corpses.
The Corsairs are extremely crafty. None of my agents can locate their headquarters. If you can help us take them down, there will be a handsome reward.
Do you have any leads I can use?
I’ll look into it if I have time. I can’t make promises.

You're a somewhat recent addition to the city. It's possible the people in the slums might open up to you. I do know that small amounts of food are being smuggled into the slums . That might be an angle you can exploit.
I don't care how you get information from the slums, so long as you get it done.
Do you have any new information about the Sand Corsairs?
There’s a group in an old tower in the west that are supplying the food to the slums.

That’s not enough evidence for me to call in reinforcements. Check it out yourself and let me know if you find more. You said it’s in that “canyon” west of that big sea of sand to the south of Levant, right?
I found out where the Sand Corsairs are hiding. They’re in the Old Levant Ruins. Some Soroboreans are protecting them. I need Yzan’s help. Where is he?
Of course Old Levant has to be connected to this... I think I have an idea what you’re planning. Yzan is by the fountain in the South-East district of Levant. Good luck.
If you need something, bother Yzan. I’m coordinating the troops right now!

I'm amazed you got their leader to surrender. He confessed everything and his troops disbanded. I don't like leaving these Old Levant troublemakers alive... but I'm not willing to slaughter a surrendering enemy.
What will you do with him now?
Put him on trial, I suppose. It’s barely a formality at this point, though. After all he’s done, he’ll either get the firing squad or be locked in the Hive Prison for the rest of his very short life.

Good work, [PlayerName]. With their leader dead, the Sand Corsairs are nothing more than disorganized rabble. We'll have the last of them put down by the end of the week. And most of them are Old Levant too. Two birds, one bullet!
Queen Calixa will no doubt recognize what you did for Levant. Here, your reward for a job well done.
No new information yet. I’ll let you know if I find some.
The ruins in the west... That’s the ruins in the small canyon west of that sand sea, I think...Hmm...

The leader of these bandits has long since flown the coop. Dammit, we should have moved faster. We may have struck a serious blow to the Corsairs, but as long as their leader is alive, they could rally…
Well, you still helped bring the Corsairs down. You’re entitled to your pay. Queen Calixa will no doubt be pleased with your work here, [PlayerName].
Things are still hectic after the declaration of war, [PlayerName]. I’ll let you know if I need you on the front lines, or on home defense soon enough. Give me a few days to sort out this mess.
I see it all from up here. The good, the bad... The Levant dream is barely holding together.
What can a poor man like me do for a mercenary like you?
You have a good view from up here. You must have seen something about the Sand Corsairs from up here.

I've seen smugglers from the tunnel hand out food down here. That's more than the army or nobles have done for us in ages. That’s all I’m willing to say about that. Torture me if you want, I’m not condemning these slums to more starvation.
What if I was able to get someone else to bring more food down here?

The only people who can operate in Abrassar with the Corsairs around are Soroboreans, and as far as their merchant in the slums is concerned, they have no interest in helping us unless there’s a massive sack of silver involved. Good luck.
I saw that Soroborean Merchant start handing out food. I don’t know how you did it, and I don’t care. I’m just glad we won’t go hungry tonight.
Alright, I’ll talk. I don’t know where the Corsairs operate from, but I know that the food they’re smuggling to us first goes through an old ruined tower in the desert first.
It's not far from the city. Head south of Levant. West of that sea of sand, there's a little canyon entrance along the mountain walls. The ruined tower is at the end of it.
So, the Corsairs were destroyed. I sure hope it was worth it to you, because no one else has pretended to care about the slums before or since.
I have to go.
Well, I’ll be. Food in the slums again. Things are looking up for the first time in months. Maybe there’s hope for Levant after all.
I don’t believe it. Our own goddess! It’ll be a while before things get better down here in the slums, but change is already beginning…
What’s on your mind?
I need you to stop extorting the people of the slums for food.
Extort? That’s a nasty word. It’s simple supply and demand, my good customer. It costs a lot of money to bring food through a desert before it goes bad!
I’m sure we can find an arrangement fair for everyone. That’s what Soroboreans do, right?
Alright, If you'll eat half my costs for the next trip here, I'll halve my prices for the people of the slums. Let's say 200 silver upfront.
The Sand Corsairs hit every caravan except Soroborean ones. Your prices shoot up in response. Don't you see how that looks suspicious?
How dare you! Still, you have a point, the coincidence does make us look bad. Hmm... I’ll give you a discount. 100 Silvers upfront and I'll lower my prices for the people of the slums.
Deal. Feed these people.
Done. I’ll hand out rations right away.
No deal.
No deal then. I’m sorry neither of us can’t afford to help them.
Nothing in particular
Then stay safe. That’s an order! I don’t like losing customers!
Hmm? What do you want? You look like you can take care of yourself, so no handouts for you. This food goes only to the starving.

In fact... someone strong like you should be on our side. These New Levant tyrants running the city clearly don't care about the people. We should be working to overthrow them and bring back the rightful heirs to the region.
You're from Old Levant, I take it?
And proud of it. We may have been reduced to scavengers picking at bones, but we have never forgotten our Abrassar Plains Pride.
Where did you get that food?
If I’m feeding people with it, does it matter where I got it?
How does some silver for that information sound? That could buy some of the people here a decent meal.
How much silver are we talking about, here?
10 silvers, start talking.
50 silvers. Where do you get the food?
100 silvers. It’ll be our secret.
I don’t think I have enough to convince you. Sorry that I asked.
That could buy a lot of people things they need... Alright, you don’t seem like a bad person, I’ll talk. I get the food from some Blue Chamber guys holed up in some old ruins.
Here, in case you end up in trouble, use this. I’d hate for my new friend to get killed before we meet again.
50? Alright, fair is fair. There’s some guys squatting in some ruins not far from the city. I don’t know how they get it and I don’t care.
Eh, there’s some ruins out there in the desert I get ‘em from, that’s pretty much it.
I know about you. You’re the one who got most of my friends killed. You watch your back in the night. Someone might stick a dagger in it.
You’re the one who arrested Zagis... I’m not sure I can forgive you, but I’m glad you spared the rest of Old Levant. Maybe we’ll have our day in the sun again because of you.
So you beat the Corsairs, good for you. But if you think Old Levant is dead, you’re wrong. We’ll return to our rightful place in the sun before long, you’ll see.
You look tough, but unless you’re opposed to those glorified troglodytes in the palace, I don’t much care for you.
Sorry, I’ve got nothing for you right now. If you’re in the mood for a little blood sport, come around in a bit, I might have room for ya.
Ooh, you look tough. Looking to wager some silver on a fight? I’ve got an opening I need to fill. One of my usual guys got eaten by a bug out there.
You seem shady enough. I'm looking for some information.
If you want something from me, you'll earn it in the ring. I run a fight club under the city. Entry fee for one round is 50 silver. If you can beat me, I'll consider talking.
Ouch. You don't pull your punches, do you? Alright, a deal is a deal. What did you want to know?
Tell me where I can find the Sand Corsairs.
Whoa whoa whoa, no deal. They'd slit my throat in my sleep if I ratted on them!
Tell me or I’ll be the one slitting your throat. Cyrene will pardon me for anything I have to do to get this information.
Maybe I should ask Cyrene to interrogate you, then.
I could just spread the word that you leaked their location, and they’d kill you anyway.

They're bad people, so I'll just tell you. They keep their operations really tight, so I don't know where they operate from. But I do know that the food the Corsairs are drip-feeding into the slums comes from an old ruined tower.
And get this, those guys are from the Blue Chamber Collective. One of those guys fought here the other day and I swear, clear as day, he had the Sutherland Family Crest tattooed on his shoulder.
So, uhh... good luck with that. I’m getting out of here before someone comes to find me.
You want a rematch, pal?
Not interested, sorry.
Ok, let’s do it.
Alright, come find me down there, and put on a good show, eh?
If you’re looking for the old fight club, it’s been closed down. Cyrene got wind of it. I’ve gone legit now, honest! I’m just a simple cactus farmer these days, I swear!
Halt! State your business... here? I remember you. That trog spawn from Cierzo with the Blood Price. What are you doing here?
I should be asking that. What's a Blue Chamber tribesman doing working with the Sand Corsairs?
None of your business. Now, you will turn around and walk away. We have orders to kill anyone who interferes with our operation, and I'd rather not spill the blood of someone from my old hometown.
You WILL tell me where the Sand Corsairs operate from, or things will get violent.
They’re hiding in the Old Levant ruins, with an army of warriors. You can’t possibly stop them alone. And now, we have to kill you. May your ancestors forgive us.
I'm invoking a Tribal Favor. Tell me what I need to know. People are starving to death.

I may be on an unsanctioned mission behind enemy lines, but I remember my duty to the Collective. A Tribal Favor must always be recognized. Fine. Even someone like Sagard should be able to understand.
Oh look, 100 silver just fell out of my pockets. Enough to buy you a place away from this awful desert.
This could buy our troops a lot of much-needed weapons... fine. I don't like what the Corsairs are doing, so I'll trade your silver for what I know. Sagard won't be happy, but he'll understand.

The Corsairs loot incoming food caravans, and then give us some of the food to deliver to the Slums. The idea was to starve Levant, and use offers of food to try to push the slum people into open revolt.
The Sand Corsairs are operating out of the ruins of Old Levant. It's that old ruined city under Abrassar's Vigil crystal. Not that it'll do you any good, you could never take the place on your own.

There are dozens of men there, and it's been camouflaged by some Soroboreans as an archaeology site. Even if you could get past them, the Corsairs have an army in there. It's a deathtrap if anyone goes in alone.
Sounds like I need backup then. Thank you for the information.
Don’t thank me. We may have found an arrangement, but until the boss calls us off, we’re enemies.

I don’t believe this. I come home after a string of victories against the Blue Chamber Collective, only to find Levant besieged by bandits! I’m not leaving here until these Sand Corsairs are in a nice sandy grave!
The Sand Corsairs are hiding in the Old Levant Ruins. Some Soroboreans are camouflaging the whole thing as an archaeology expedition.
What?! Why in Elatt’s name would Sorobor be helping them? Great, how do we raid the place without triggering a diplomatic incident?
You still have some merchant contacts, right? We need camouflage of our own to get inside...
Aha! I see your plan. You want me to dress some troops up as merchants and weasel in with no one the wiser!
Yup, that's the plan. Can you do it?

Not a bad plan... There’s one problem. Cyrene told me that Old Levant is connected to an old cave system. "The Slide", she called it. If we go in the front, it's possible that the Corsairs will sneak out back using the tunnel.
I can try going in from the tunnel to cut them off.
Easy, you go in the front, I'll take the tunnel. Divide and conquer.
That should work. If they try to escape, the Slide is narrow enough that one or two warriors would be more than enough to hold it. I’ll gather some troops and put the plan into motion.

One entrance is a cave near some marooned ships not far from Abrassar's Vigil crystal. Here, I took this key from a Corsair I killed the other day. I think it might be for one of the doors inside the Slide. You may need it.
I can’t believe you got that bastard to surrender. You must have a silver tongue, [PlayerName]!

Excellent work today, [PlayerName]. With their leader dead, it’s only a matter of time before we’ve cleaned out the rest of these criminals. The Sand Corsairs and Old Levant will be a distant memory before long.
I don’t believe this! The leader of these murderous criminals got away before we even got here! We may have crushed the Corsairs here today, but with that bastard still alive, they'll be back!
The question remains, what do we do about this man? He’s a Soroborean banker who was funding the entire operation. He could easily be the brains behind it all.
You still went along with their unhinged plans. You’re still a war criminal as far as I’m concerned. I think we ought to make an example of you. Cyrene, do we give him the firing squad or hanging?
Well, I guess that wraps this mission up. Report to Cyrene over there and we can call it a day.
If you want the real culprits, point your fingers at Sagard Battleborn of the Blue Chamber, and at Zagis himself. All I did was keep things running smoothly.

Hold up there a minute! Do you think Sorobor will take the execution of one of their most rich and reputable bankers lightly? We’re the only way to get supplies through the desert. Kill me, and you kill Levant itself.
I don't think Sorobor would be happy if this scandal went public, though. They might arrange for you to disappear to save their reputation.
Ah, I see. You want a personal favor in exchange for your silence. Very well, you’re not the first to blackmail me. What kind of favor are we talking about?
Double your food deliveries to Levant, at a quarter of the price. People are starving to death.
Ouch. You drive a hard bargain, but I don't really have a choice, do I? I'll see that it's done. At least, until the war is over.
The best kind of favor. The kind we get to decide on whenever we need it.
Very well. If you need my extensive finances, just drop my name, and I'll handle it for you. As long as you don't tell Sorobor what I was doing, my word is gold.
Alright, alright. Stop waving that weapon around, I’ll come quietly!
What’s with the look? I always keep up my end of a bargain, you have nothing to worry about.
Bow, Levantine rat. For you stand before the rightful king of Abrassar! I am Zagis, Chamberlord of Old Levant, lord of the Sand Corsairs.
So you're the leader of these murderous thugs.

I do what I must in order to restore the rightful legacy of the Abrassar plains. Elatt gave away what he had no right to! Just because Calixa and Simeon slew the Devourer does not mean my people should surrender what is ours by right!
Your people abandoned Abrassar to the Scourge. Maybe it’s someone else’s turn to run things.
Being recognized as the rulers of Abrassar means so much to you, that you’ll turn your people into bandits and murderers?
They don’t even recognize the laws of the Blue Chamber! Without rigid tribal law, there is no hope for survival!
Levant seems to have survived pretty well without them, before you started trying to starve them to death and murdering traders.
You’re just scared of change. So scared you turned Old Levant from tribes to be respected into a band of murdering bandits.
That may be true. But it was all I could do to keep the flame of Old Levant alive. I will not be the one to extinguish that legacy! I would rather die than let Old Levant be destroyed!
Then surrender honorably. Take responsibility for your actions, and end this conflict before your people end up slaughtered!

... You’re right. I don’t want to admit it, but you’re right. There is no point in championing the ideals of Old Levant if there is no one left to look up to them. I will surrender. I will call off my warriors.
Then the only way my people will be safe is to kill you. Defend yourself, Zagis!

Ah, you. Levant needs your help. Cyrene will have all the details for you. Until these Sand Corsairs are dealt with, the fate of Levant is balanced on a knife’s edge. If Sirocco were to stop sending us food...

If Calixa and I weren’t tied up with royal duties or the war, we’d deal with those damned brigands ourselves. I miss being out in the field, making a difference. I haven’t had a good fight since we killed the Devourer, and that was decades ago!
Sorry, no visitors around the excavation site! There are delicate historical artifacts being unearthed, and we can’t risk theft or damage. Please, wait for us to complete our work.
What exactly are you excavating?

These are the remains of the old capital of Abrassar, before the Scourge erupted. They’re full of ancient history that we’re working to preserve. The bandits that used to hide out here have already ruined a great deal of it.
You've made an impression on Simeon and Calixa, [PlayerName]. They’ve expressed an interest in sponsoring you personally. You’ll be getting your jobs from them from now on. Congratulations.
You’re off to the Hallowed Marsh are you? Best of luck. We’re counting on you and Kirouac, [PlayerName]. We’ll handle the war on our end.
How goes the war?
Badly. We were crushing the Blue Chamber before, but now... they’ve doubled their army’s size! We’re being forced back by sheer numbers. An attack on Abrassar could come at any time…
I’m impressed. Kirouac came home and was singing your praises. Levant lives to fight another day. Now, it’s time to truly take the fight to the Blue Chamber.

Dammit, dammit, dammit. Bad enough we have to fight the Blue Chamber tribes, but to have to put down a slum revolt... Because of them, we were forced to spill our own people’s blood. I will never forgive them for this.
Thank you for coming, [PlayerName]. Levant is in grave danger. Not only has the war turned against us, but we face imminent famine. We need a mercenary who can get things done.

Disaster has struck Sirroco. They can no longer send food to Levant. Without the steady supply of goods from their region, it's only a matter of time before starvation begins. We need a new food source.
The city of Monsoon in the Hallowed Marsh has offered to supply us, but the small amount of bread and dried meat isn't enough. Yet, everything else perishes on the desert journey...
Kirouac has gone to Monsoon to work with their alchemist, Laine Aberforth to find some kind of food that might last long enough to survive the journey. Do anything you can to make this work.
We have enough food to last about a month. After that, there won't be enough to keep everyone in the slums fed.
I've heard you've done a lot to help the slums! Right now they have a steady food supply, and enough rations to last about a month and a half before our shortages become extreme.
Levant's survival is on the line. Make it happen. Find Kirouac and Laine in Monsoon as soon as you can.
I’ll do it. Take care of Levant while I’m gone.
Can you do anything to help me?
Unfortunately, the war has ravaged our treasury. We cannot afford to give you any support. I'm sorry.
[PlayerName]! You're a miracle worker! The first shipment of Marshmelons showed up right before you did!
We managed to avert disaster completely because of your efforts. As far as I'm concerned, you have more than risen to the ideals of the Heroic Kingdom.
Sadly, it comes too late for many people. Our supplies of food were so depleted that they had to be severely rationed while you were gone. The slums went into open revolt. There's... no one left.
Dammit... I should have done something more... Sent more people, more money, something. I've failed my people.
We will call on you again when we have a task that needs your talents. In the meantime, we have a war to deal with.
The moment Levant needs me, send word.
That we shall, [PlayerName]. You have earned our trust.
I want to fight on the front lines too!
Talent such as yours would be wasted out there. Canon fodder rarely makes a difference. But here, you’ve proven you can do more than five men.
We may have a task for you in the near future, [PlayerName]. One of our allies is teetering on the brink of ruin. If they fall, we will be in dire need of your service!

I’m sorry, [PlayerName], but a lot of things weigh on my mind. The murder of my youngest son remains unsolved, and I fear that the one responsible will strike again. I cannot rest until the one responsible is brought to justice.
I’ll look into it, your highness.
I’m sure Cyrene will catch the culprit. Is there anything else that I can do to help Levant?

Oh, by the way, Kirouac told me that during his experimentation he created a mixture that seems to permanently increase one's strength. He wanted you to have it. He also said to drink it straight away before it spoiled.

I've just returned from a sortie with our troops fighting the Blue Chamber Collective. We’re taking a pounding out there. Their army has nearly doubled in size over the past month. I don't understand how they did it.
And now Sirroco can't supply us any more. This is a horrendous one-two punch to the Heroic Kingdom!
Hey! If it isn't [PlayerName]! Bringer of Marshmelons! We should make that your official title!
Please don't.
Not bad. I want it printed on my tunic.
Hey now, I’m just joking!
Ugh. Nothing is worse than having to fight your own people. But they didn't really leave me much of a choice.
I'll second that. Slaying some massive beast is always impressive to talk about, but saving so many lives from famine is a much nobler deed.
Thank you for your efforts. As king of Levant, I have a gift from our armory. You have more than earned it for your hard work, [PlayerName].
We did the best we could, Calixa. If I didn't put down the slum revolt, they would have sacked and burned the city. It's a tragedy, but there's nothing more we could have done.
Either way, Levant lives to fight another day because of your help, [PlayerName]. You deserve a reward.
Ah, [PlayerName]! My hero! Good to see you again! I'm glad Calixa sent you to help.
Ah, [PlayerName]! I was expecting you.

Laine and I have begun our work. So far, it's not promising. The best option we have is the Marshmelon. If we could transport these to Levant, we would solve our famine overnight. But they dont last long enough to survive the trip.
Speak with Laine, he'll tell you what we need in order to continue our work.
So, you're an alchemist, Kirouac?
Yes. But this is proving to be a very tricky problem. Nothing seems to work. Salt is useless, drying Marshmelons just makes them rot faster, cold flames ruin it... I'm at my wit's end, [PlayerName].
Let me know how it goes with the Soroborean merchant, eh, [PlayerName]? I won’t get my hopes up. Laine’s plan is beyond the realm of practicality…
I can’t believe you made this work. I’ll go home with the first Marshmelon delivery. I want to personally make sure your hard work pans out.
I’m here to talk about Levant’s food shortage.
You're the one Levant sent to help us? Good, I could use a hand. I’ve almost used my entire stock of Marshmelons in my experiments, and there’s a really tricky ingredient that I need brought in.
Did you bring the ingredients I need? I need 5 raw Marshmelons and a Phytosaur’s Horn.
I’ve got your ingredients. Elatt’s breath, they’re heavy.
I’m still looking for them.
I've got about one possible solution left, and to test it, I’m going to need 5 marshmelons and 1 Phytosaur horn. You’ll recognize them by their 4 legs and the ferns on their back.
The Marshmelons shouldn’t be too hard to find, although they’re pretty heavy. As for the Phytosaur horn, if you can’t find one out in the swamp, you may have better luck underground.

A Phytosaur horn! Yes, perfect, thank you! Now, I just need to soak the plant in a mixture with this overnight and hope for the best. If I'm right, this should fool the Marshmelon plant into thinking it's still growing in the swamp.
Come back in about 12 hours, alright? In the meantime, I’ll work on a few other ideas Kirouac had, although I have my doubts about them.
If my hunch is right, we may need to ask the Soroboreans for help and it can’t be cheap... Try to scrounge up some extra coin in the meantime .
Success. That Phytosaur horn’s toxin was the key. I finally found one viable option to bring Marshmelons to Levant, but it's downright crazy.

If we manage to uproot entire Marshmelon plants, and keep them submerged in marsh dirt and a mixture of water and boiled Phytosaur horn toxin all the way to Levant, we might be able to bring them before they spoil.
Do you have any idea how heavy and large those plants are? How can we move entire Marshmelon plants as far as Levant?
We'll have to ask a Soroborean merchant. They're the only ones with the resources to haul something so gigantic. I hope your pockets are deep, my friend, this won’t run you cheap.
I’ve done all I can, you’ll need to speak with a Soroborean to handle the rest. I’ll keep improving the Phytosaur Horn preservation formula.
Well, we did the best we could. This should work, although I’m still crossing my fingers that it holds out for the whole trip. It’s a long, long journey to Levant.
I’m still working on it, [PlayerName]. Come back later.
Yes, I heard about that. Sadly, I don’t think there’s much more we can do. The journey there is much too long to bring the amount of food they need.
I need Sorobor to deliver entire Marshmelon plants to Levant.
Ahahaha! Ahahaha, I'm sorry, for a second I thought you just asked me if we could deliver entire Marshmelon plants to Levant! That's a good one!
Elatt's name you're not joking... Give me a minute, I need to speak with some people about this.

Listen, [PlayerName], I've spoken with my contacts about this and we all agree, this is insanity. Do you have any idea how hard it is to dig up massive swamp plants, plus keep them alive crossing a desert?! Have you lost your mind?
Levant's survival depends on it.

I had a feeling that was the case, but the price to set this up is out of your range. That said, you're the adventurous type, aren't you? There is something you can do that we'd consider a fair trade.

There's an ancient peace treaty that was written on a stone tablet shortly after the scourge. Old Language on one side, New Language on the other. It could effectively be used to translate things written in the Old Language.
A "Rosetta Stone", if you know Aurai's ancient history. That would be an incredible boon to Sorobor's interests. Bring it to us, and we'll help you with your Marshmelon business.
And what's the catch?
The catch is that the Tablet is in the possession of the Light Mender. That Lich who lives in the Spire in the South-West of the swamp. And he doesn't want to share it.
You want me to steal from a Lich? That's the only way?
Yes. Arm yourself well, the Light Mender is especially hostile. His spire is guarded with minions made of light and specters... and they spit lightning! Be wary, and avoid a fight with him.
A Lich's stone tablet. Steal it. No problem.
I can't tell how much of that is bravado and how much is your ignorance. Risking the fury of an immortal Lich is nothing like bopping a troglodyte on the head. Avoid fighting him if you can.
You got it. I don't know how you did it, but you got it. Well done. I've spoken with Laine about what we need to do, and it seems feasible, but barely. I've got just about everything set up.

Unfortunately my contacts and favors are all tapped out. I need another investment of 300 silver to wrap this up and get started, but I'm out of places to borrow the money. A lot of people went all in on this plan.
Here’s your 300 silver. Make it happen.
Thank you! Alright, with this I can finance the last step of the process! Your first shipment of Marshemlon plants will be in Levant in a matter of days!
I'll send a courier to Levant to let them know they no longer need to worry about the famine and can stop rationing their food.
Tell Clayton that [PlayerName] is calling in a favor. I think you'll find that he will be willing to help finance this little business venture.
Ahhhh, yes, he told me about you. He said to give you the preferential treatment if you needed anything big. Heh, you must have something really good on him. I'll send him the bill.
I'll go find the money, I'll be back.

Good, let me know as soon as you have enough. The containers and specialized wagon are ready, the preservation solution is good, I just need to hire some men to dig up the plants and bring them in and I can roll out to Levant with them.
If you want Sorobor Academy’s help with this insane Marshmelon transportation plan, you’ll need to bring me the Stone Tablet that the Lich in the South-West spire is keeping. Good luck.
I need to talk to you about ending the famine in Levant.
Don’t worry, everything is going fine on this end. Go report back to Levant, we’ll handle the rest from here.
My troops have been recalled. The armies of the Collective demolished them in the field. Half of them are dead.
So much for the Blue Chamber’s policy of unnecessary killing. Their troops have been slaughtering our people. They don’t even try to take prisoners anymore.
Their true evil is laid bare now. I can never forgive them for what they’ve done to Levant.
I hear you secured a new source of food for the Kingdom. Well done. My men and I are in your debt, [PlayerName].
Because those damn Blues tried to starve us out, the slums went into open revolt... I had to kill my own starving countrymen to save the city. Dammit. I can never forgive them for this.
(An ancient looking tablet lies here. This is probably the one the Soroborean wanted.)
(Take it)
(Leave it)
(An ancient looking tablet lies here. It might be of interest to someone who is well traveled.)
(This looks like the stone tablet I was tasked to find. Let’s take it and bring it back.)
(This ornate granite tablet is covered in the symbols of an old language. It might be useful later.)

[PlayerName] urgent news has arrived. Messengers from the Hallowed Marsh have come. Elatt demands peace. Quite insistently. The Holy Mission is willing to handle negotiations to ensure that the peace is fair to us.

The Blue Chamber's armies have grown too strong, too quickly. This is the best hope we have of getting a fair deal. If we turn this down, we risk losing the war entirely, or risk them being able to make truly obscene demands of us.
The war has been devastating to all of us, I'm glad to see it end.
After everything the Blue Chamber Collective has done to Levant? We're just going to let them off that easily?
At least the Holy Mission and Elatt are known for being fair. If they're overseeing the peace negotiations, I can live with it.

Something has me on edge, though. As soon as this news arrived, Cyrene and Yzan disappeared, and some of our troops have vanished along with them. I suspect they mean to betray us to prevent these talks from happening.
You think they've taken the war too personally and would resort to treason?
I trust Cyrene and Yzan, they wouldn't do something like that.
Considering what's happened, I wouldn't be surprised if they're that desperate to avoid peace.

War does things to people's minds. Yzan can't forgive their support of the Sand Corsairs and Cyrene has taken the loss of so many of our troops very personally. I want to believe in them, but I can't ignore this possibility.

You have given us every reason to trust you, [PlayerName]. I need another encore performance of your talent. I need you to find Cyrene and Yzan, and if they are preparing to betray Levant, stop them however you can.
I'll find them, believe me.
I have no doubt. I just hope you find them before they do something all of us will regret.
You trust me with this? You don't think I'd side against you?
I know that you understand that prolonging this war will lead to the destruction of Levant. Yes, I trust you.
Until the situation is dealt with, we will have to shut down all access to the Palace, even for you. We can't take any chances. Best of luck.
(A wave of heat fills you, like the rays of the sun. Calixa speaks to you in your mind)
I’m... adjusting. I won’t lie, this is a bizarre state of existence. I’m not sure I’ll ever get used to it. Still, I persist. It’s an improvement over death.
I too, have a gift for you, for all you’ve done for Levant.
(A cool breath of wind flows through you, like a breeze at an Oasis. Calixa has blessed you with new strength)
I name you Champion of the Heroic Kingdom of Levant, and give you freedom to pursue whatever desire you have. You have proven your skill and commitment to Levant, and I trust in your judgment.
Once Simeon is ready to return to Levant, I will as well. There is much to do if I’m going to live up to the title of goddess. Our kingdom needs people like you.
The world is yours, [PlayerName]. Follow your heart, and nothing will stand in your way.
The home front is quiet... for now. The fighting on the front lines of the war goes poorly. If it keeps going the way it is now, the war may come to Abrassar directly If that happens, be ready.
The Blue Chamber has entered a cease-fire until the negotiations happen, but who knows how long it will hold?
Oh, that reminds me, under the terms of the cease-fire, your banishment from Berg has been lifted. If you return to Enmerkar in the future, you will be allowed to enter the city once more.
I've been standing watch for so long, I don't feel my throat anymore. Why can’t they issue a few extra waterskins to us grunts? Gah, I’d kill for some water right about now!
Stop! The smuggler’s tunnel is beyond this point, you don’t have permission to access it! No matter who you are! Turn around and leave!
(Give Waterskin) Here, you wanted water? Take it and let me pass.
... Gah! Fine! I’m pretty sure you’re not a bad person after all you’ve done, and it’s not like you can get into the palace without a key anyway. Fine, go ahead, you can use the tunnel!

Oh, I agree that the war needs to end too, for everyone's sake, but I'm just not comfortable making ourselves vulnerable like this. If it were anyone but Elatt asking us to make peace, I wouldn't even consider it.
Trust me, I'm not pleased about this either. As long as the Blue Chamber negotiates in good faith, I'm willing to listen. But if they're unreasonable, my fists will do the talking.
That's the only reason I'm giving Elatt's demand any consideration. After what the Blue Chamber did to us, the famine, everything, it'll take a god mediating these talks to get me to show up.
Likewise. They're good soldiers, but they and their troops have seen too much conflict. I have no doubt they believe continuing the war is the only acceptable course of action.
They can't have left Abrassar. If the pair of them are plotting treason, they're likely hiding someplace nearby. Likely somewhere man-made.
We found a strange message in Yzan’s home, by the way. "Meet me where the boats used to be tied, high and dry. Come soon." Make of that what you will, it means little to me.
Elatt damn it all... I got careless. Cyrene shot Calixa from the balcony, and when I charged her, her goons fired a barrage of lead at me.
That voice in my head just now... Was that Elatt? Is what he says true? Can he really save Calixa?
I'll organize a convoy to Monsoon immediately. [PlayerName], I need you to come to Monsoon as swiftly as possible.
I’ll come with you on the convoy.
I have something to do first. I’ll make my own way to Monsoon. I’ll meet you there.
Fine. But come to Monsoon as swiftly as possible. The longer we wait, the worse it will be for us.
I hear you defended your front of the battle with style, [PlayerName]. You should be proud. Even that bastard Sagard was impressed.
What happened with Calixa? How is she doing?
It’s strange to have her present in my mind like this, but I’m sure we’ll make it work. She’s already blessed me with great power. I feel like she’s always watching my back now.

I hear you let those Scourge Beasts get the better of you. Well, no shame in that. Not everyone is cut out to be a hero. You did your best and casualties were kept to a minimum. That’s all that matters, really.
You’ve earned this reward, [PlayerName]. May you wear it well.
It’s a good thing you’re here, [PlayerName]. We’re going to bring the war to an end, but... I’ll let Calixa explain. She’s better with words than me.

I hope you can find Cyrene and Yzan before they turn on us, [PlayerName]. We've sent most of the guards from the palace to join the war. I'm pretty much the only one left to protect the palace if they start a civil war.
Hey, [PlayerName]. Good to see you in one piece, how go your adventures?
(Simeon is injured, but alive.)
I’ve heard about where “the boats used to be tied, high and dry." It’s a nursery rhyme about the region, before the Scourge. The boats were kept at the docks, to the north of Abrassar.
(These footprints are easy to identify. It’s Yzan’s prosthetic leg! They are pointing north, to the old docks on top of the cliffs.)
[PlayerName], I take it you got my message? I’m glad you made it.
[PlayerName], how did you find me here? We camouflaged ourselves as best we could!
Well, now that you're here, I may as well ask. Cyrene and I could use your help. We need to move against Calixa and Simeon before they agree to this ridiculous peace and doom us all.
You'd betray Levant, Yzan?
No, it's Simeon and Calixa who are betraying Levant. They want to make peace with an enemy that has committed unforgivable crimes against us. It shames the dead!
Why are you hesitating? The head that wears the crown doesn't matter, it's what they stand for. Simeon and Calixa didn't stop the Sand Corsairs or brought food to Levant. We did that. You and me.
You think that the people who founded the Heroic Kingdom have forgotten what it's about?
Power corrupts the mind. They have held power for too long and grown complacent! I see no other reason why they'd accept peace talks!
They could have done more if they weren't forced to pour so many resources and people into this losing war!
I... I know that's right. I know how badly the war depleted our treasury. But still! They should have done more! Simeon should have been on the front lines with us!
Maybe they just aren't blinded by rage like you and Cyrene. You've both been on the front lines too much to see the bigger picture.
You're telling me that I should just let go of what happened to our troops? To our people? Rage is the only appropriate response!
Why are you arguing to spare the Blue Chamber from our justice? This war has only proven that the ideals of Levant are better for everyone than what the Blue Chamber believes in!
