There are three people I’m aware of that need some help. Ease the burdens of any one of them, and you will have proven to me that you are ready to join us.

Mofat, one of our oldest members, can be found in the residential area of Monsoon and is in need of a certain alchemy ingredient. Zephyrien, one of our Champions, is in this Temple and needs someone to brew a potion.

And then there’s Monsoon’s Chamberlord, Damian Lockwell, whose paranoia could use calming down. He is across that bridge to the right once you leave the temple. They’re all important to this city, so take the time to introduce yourself too.
Welcome to Elatt's Temple, traveller. Be at ease, all are welcome here.
At attention Zephyrien, we have a guest! What do you need from us, pilgrim?
Hey there, do you need the help of a Champion? Just point me at the problem, and Soeran or I will take care of it!
I'm considering joining the Holy Mission, actually.
Let me take a look at you... I see potential there, but it's very much a gem in the rough. What do you think, Zephyrien?
Yep, you'll do. You look like you can handle a good scrap. As long as you're joining us to help people, that's good enough for me, really.
You're both Champions? I have trouble telling you apart with that armor.
That's easy. I'm the one of us who actually bothers to wear the helmet. Also, I'm the one with the warhammer. It's more than just a weapon to kill things with, it's a tool to rebuild what we've lost.

And I happen to believe that if you have to get into a fight, you don't go armed with a stick. You use maximum force to remove whatever passes for the threat's head, and resolve the problem right there.
What is serving Elatt like?
It's amazing. Every day, we make a difference in people's lives. Bearing some small portion of a god's power in your very being is incredible.
It's also very dangerous. You will need to lay your life on the line daily. The three Pillars demand self-sacrifice…it's not for the faint of heart!
You will likely be following the missionary's path. Your tasks will take you to places far and wide, to deal with conflicts that need to be resolved.
And what do Champions do?

Elatt's Champions are the pinnacle of the missionary's path. We are blessed with great strength, to enforce the peace. Whether that's destroying invading Scourge monsters, or punishing bandits on a kidnapping spree.

If you're thinking of replacing one of us, think again. Elatt may be powerful, but he's not omnipotent. He can only provide the raw energy needed for two Champions at any given time. And neither of us has any intention of retiring anytime soon.
Well, nice meeting you both.
Nice to meet you, Pilgrim. I hope our paths cross again sometime.
I hope to see you out there in the field, pilgrim! Take the dive and join us!
I look forward to working with you, pilgrim. May Elatt welcome you.
Hey, if you ever want to gain the power of magic, we have our own path to the Ley Line under the Conflux Mountain. If you need backup, I could take you.
I can definitely tell you’ve got the spirit for it, but one needs discipline to walk the martial path of the Holy Mission.
Discipline... Right, that reminds me! I need a discipline potion. My stocks are low... If you could bring me one, I'd be in your debt.
If you can’t find one for me, it’s pretty easy to brew. I’ll give you the recipe scroll. I don't care if you brew it or buy it, personally.
I have that discipline potion for you, Zephyrien.
Perfect, this'll be a big help. I sometimes feel like can't even make it through the day without at least one of these!

Hey, by way of thanks, do you want to know how to make a Warrior's Elixir? You need to put Larva eggs, Krimp nuts, Crystal powder and water into an alchemy set and steam it! It’s a real help when you’re preparing for a big fight.
Greetings, traveler. You are welcome to find sanctuary with me for as long as you need to.
Oh, a visitor! Welcome to the city of Monsoon! If you see any Scourge, let me know and I’ll clear them out, no problem!
I'm a busy man, visitor. If you don’t have business with me, move along.
I was told to introduce myself to you, and that you need some kind of help.

Oh, winds be damned, you're another stupid pilgrim aren't you? You listen to me, visitor, you can't trust Elatt. Do you know what happens to people who serve him? He puts just a little bit of his soul inside you, and it just grows and grows until you're not you anymore.

I had to watch as someone I loved drifted further and further away, and then left forever without even bothering to say goodbye, all for this supposed "god". I don't know what Elatt is, but he's definitely not divine. If it wasn't for my opposition, I have no doubt he'd have enslaved this entire swamp by now!
I'll keep what you said in mind.
Bah, if you bend your knee to Elatt, you soon won't have a mind to keep it in. Don't make that mistake.
The people of Monsoon owe you a lot.
Don't bother sweet-talking me, I don't care. If you value your free will, just stay as far away from that... "thing" as you can.
You're raving. Elatt is the only reason we beat back the Scourge!

Did he, though? It's awfully convenient for him that we have to depend on him to hold off the Scourge. How can we be sure he's not playing them like puppets to make us worship him? Trusting in him is foolish to the extreme.
You just remember my warning. Don’t offer your free will to Elatt, he’ll gobble it right up.
Look, you want to do something to help me? Become a mage. By being in tune with life's vibrations, you'll resist that... "thing's" influence far better than a normal person.
Heed my warning, pilgrim. Do not sell your free will to Elatt. If your heart is set on taking that risk, become a mage.

So, you're a fellow mage, are you? Well, don't say I didn't warn you... Here, a gift from one mage to another. Considering all the nasty animals crawling in the swamp, this recipe might save your life!

You know how to become a mage, right? You’ll need to travel to the Ley Line underneath the Conflux Mountain in the Chersonese. I know one of Elatt’s Champions usually hangs around the Holy Mission’s entrance to help new recruits.
(Pray to catch Elatt’s attention.)
(Offer a prayer to Elatt.)
(Ask for guidance.)
Elatt, I want to join the Holy Mission.
(A voice speaks in your head. It’s gruff, but kind.)
Welcome, [PlayerName]. I am Elatt, god of discipline.
I’m hearing voices in my head!
Well, yes. I am Living Thought. How else did you think I'd speak with you?
My lord! It's an honor to hear your voice!
There is no need for you to speak to me like that. I do not require reverence from my followers. Only their dedication. Even one good deed is worth more than a thousand words of worship.
Alright, how do you do it? Is there a sorcerer hiding inside the altar?
Hah! Do you wish to check for yourself?
Huh... It's totally solid. If this is a trick, it's very impressive.
Indeed. A trick so impressive I lost my physical form, becoming Living Thought. I assure you, I am the genuine article. No tricks here.
You should know, Damian Lockwell is paranoid about you.
I am aware. He disappoints me, but he is free to come to his own conclusions. Only he has the power to change his views of me.
Do you think I have a place the Holy Mission?

I sense a certain potential in you...If you wish, I will accept you into my Holy Mission. But be warned, to accept my blessing is to become the mortal enemy of all Scourgekind. They will seek your destruction everywhere.

Always remember the three pillars of our cause. First, no one should suffer. Give of yourself, seek to ease the pains of others. Second, no one is perfect. Always work to improve yourself, in mind and body. Third, no one is safe. To protect Aurai, one must have iron discipline.
Above all, never do something you do not understand. You must think and question the world around you! Only then will achieve truth.
[PlayerName], will you cast aside all the ties that bind you, and live your life for the good of all people on Aurai, and become a shield against the Scourge and the Corruption?
That depends. What happens when I join you?

Ah, you are thinking. Good. If you join me, I will grant you a small portion of my essence, which will empower you to better protect others. However, the Scourge can sense it and will be driven to attack you, as they are driven to kill me.
On second thought... I'm not ready for this.
That is your right. I confess that I'm disappointed. My offer stands, should you change your mind.
(You call out to Elatt, but you do not hear his voice... Will you pledge yourself to the Holy Mission?)
Yes, I commit myself to your cause.
(You feel your spirit grow in strength. It's warm, like being close to a campfire.)

Then it is done. I welcome you into my heart, [PlayerName] and grant you the title of Missionary. Do good in my name, and I shall do good by you. I reward those who prove their Love, Self-improvement, and Discipline with newfound power.

I shall grant you the power to bind light to your weapon. It is a spell, so if you wish to make use of it, you should head to the Holy Mission’s entrance on the Conflux Mountain in the Chersonese the next time your travels take you there.

Zephyrien often trains there, and may guide your through the path to the Ley Line, where you can gain the power of Mana. I am certain you will be called to visit the Chersonese on a mission soon enough.
Ellinara will give you tasks on my behalf. Speak with her from time to time, and she will tell you what needs doing. She is just outside my Temple’s entrance.
So we aren't going to speak like this again?
To narrow my focus to any precise place or person blinds me to events going on everywhere else. To continue to protect Aurai, I must see the larger view.
If you prove your dedication to the cause, we shall speak again, as I bestow upon you new tools for your work.
Finally... I sense the potential of a great mage within you. Should you wish to open yourself up to Mana, seek our entrance to the Conflux Mountain. Zephyrien often travels there and will glady help.
(You do not hear Elatt’s voice from the altar, but you feel connected to it somehow, like a spider’s thread links you to it.)
(As you reach out to Elatt, you see a a flash of a strange skeleton in a cave in the Chersonese...)
(As you reach out to Elatt, you see the Blue Chamber in Berg, with diplomats starting to gather for a meeting... You sense... worry.)
(As you reach out to Elatt, you see Oliele in the slums of the Kingdom of Levant... You sense... equal parts curiosity and concern.)
(As you reach out to Elatt, you see both Enmerkar and Abrassar, as if from very high up. You sense... burning righteous fury.)
(As you reach out to Elatt, you see flashes of every region, as Elatt watches over Aurai. You sense... satisfaction.)
(You feel like this is a major turning point in your life... Will you dedicate yourself to the Holy Mission of Elatt?)
(You sense nothing from the altar.)
(As you reach out to Elatt, you see a campsite near a mountain along the Pilgrim Road. You sense... confusion and concern.)
(An Altar to Elatt is placed here. If you wish to speak to him, this would be the place to do it.)
Oh! [PlayerName]! You came! How are you holding up?
I’m doing alright. How are things for you?
The journey was a lot harder than I thought it would be. What about you?
I’ve joined the Holy Mission and spoken with Elatt himself. I’ve become a Missionary in his service. He is... a lot less formal than I expected. He hasn’t forgotten what it’s like to be human.
Have you given my previous words any thought? About joining the Holy Mission with me?
I’ve been thinking about it.
Not really. Joining the Holy Mission doesn’t really interest me that much.
Well, thanks for coming anyways. It’s nice to see a familiar face.
If you choose to join us, you should speak with Cardinal Bourlamaque. He will ask Elatt to judge your worth. You’ll find him in the temple in the northern part of Monsoon.
Oh, I didn’t tell you, did I? I made the trip to the Conflux Mountain and opened myself to Mana. I’m glad Zephyrien had my back for that. It was a challenge.

A new pilgrim, huh? It's good to see new blood come into the Holy Mission. I'm getting too old for active duty, shameful as that is. I miss the good old days when I could wallop a Scourge Beast with a mere quarterstaff!
How old are we talking?
I knew Elatt before he was a grown man. I can still remember a time before the Scourge, when Elatt and I would journey across Aurai without that threat hanging over us.

Bourlamaque sent you to help me, didn't he? Good timing too. My eyesight isn't what it used to be. Wandering around at night in the marsh is getting very difficult for me. And I could really use some Firefly powder for one of my experiments.
You know how to get firefly powder, right? Get some fireflies to follow you around and bring them to a kind of flat red flower. Then, collect the powder that the flower provides.

Ah, firefly powder! Exactly what I needed. Thank you, you've done good by me. Say... I’ll let you in on my secret recipe, my friend. Remember, moderation is the key. Drink this potion too often and you'll find yourself thinking in slow motion!
Watch yourself out in the Marsh. It’s never safe out there. Drop your guard for an instant and you’ll either be lizard food, or end up swimming in toxic water.
What’s on your mind?
We need to talk about that trouble in the swamp.
I think I’ve tried every alchemical combination of ingredients in Aurai by this point. It’s hard to accept there may be no more discoveries!
Welcome to the city of Monsoon, home of Elatt, the god of discipline. If you have any problems at all, or see a Scourge Beast of any kind, please let us know, and we will take care of it.
Talk is cheap. I prefer action. Unless someone is in trouble, I don’t much care for small-talk.
I’ve always enjoyed coming here. You can really feel the hum of Mana as it passes through the mountain.
Well, well, a visitor! Careful around this place, it’s full of nasty Troglodytes. If you want to get to the heart of the mountain, this is probably the quickest way, but also the most dangerous.
If you want to go ahead, I’ll give you a hand. I’ll watch your back, Champion’s honor!
Ah! [PlayerName]! You made it! Welcome, my friend, to the Heroic Kingdom of Levant!
Well, look what the sand swept in. My favourite bandit. What brings you to my city, [PlayerName]?
I'm just passing through.
Enjoy your stay, then, my friend.
Sure, fine. Just be aware that in this city, thieves get locked up outdoors in the sun. Unless you’re looking for a nasty tan, behave yourself.
(Give 50 Silver) I’m sorry about earlier. Here, I’ll pay you back, plus interest.
Maybe there’s some hope for you after all. Fine. It’s in the past now.
I want to join Levant.
I suppose even I can't turn my nose up at an extra pair of hands, even when they're known to steal from me.
Good to hear! We could always use someone who knows what they're doing.
You will need someone with high status to vouch for you if you want to stay. We're facing an overpopulation crisis and we need to be sure our new people are actually useful.

You should try Cyrene, by the entrance to the Palace, she'll approve you if you can help our army. Or you can always make a deal with Sir Montgomery, the Baron of the slums. He's usually outside his manor.
(Say nothing.)
You’ve gotten approval from someone? Perfect. Now go to the palace and request citizenship from Queen Calixa. She doesn’t refuse those who’ve been vouched for.
Oh, wonderful, another mouth to feed. We need mercenaries who can handle the dangers of the desert, not refugees.
Show me that you’re a mage, and I’ll give you my approval. We could always use more people who know how to use Mana. You know how to unlock the power of Mana, right?
Hmm, you'll do. If you can survive the journey to the Ley Line, you're not some helpless refugee. I'll vouch for you on behalf of Levant's army. Queen Calixa will be glad to let you stay.
Here, If you’re going to be doing mercenary work for me, I think you might need these. The mercenary across from me can teach you how to use it, if you don’t know how already.
Your request to join the Heroic Kingdom has been approved. All that’s left is for you to introduce yourself to the royal family.
Go to the Conflux Mountain in the Chersonese. That large purple one. Up along the side of the mountain is a passage with our flag beside it. Use that to get inside and down to the Ley Line.
A visitor, huh? Behave yourself in my city, or you’ll end up locked in the open-air cage in the slums.
You must be that one that Yzan was talking about from Cierzo. Square things with him first, and then maybe we can talk. He’s down by the fountain near the Inn.
I have nothing to say to you, priest. If you’re not here to help us win the war, I have no use for you.
You must be the one that Yzan told me about. Yzan, deal with them, would you?
A new refugee, hmm? I'm Baron Montgomery. So long as you pay your dues, you're welcome to stay, as far as I'm concerned.
You look like the adventurous type. If you bring me 200 silver coins, I'll vouch for you and give you a place to stay. That's a better deal than a lot of people can hope for these days.
Excellent. Here's a letter of introduction for our Queen. She'll arrange for your citizenship. Oh, and here. Your place to stay. Find a stretch of ground that's not occupied and roll that out.
Hey now, what's with that look? I kept up my end of the deal, didn't I? You should show some gratitude!
Shoo, now. You have your approval to become a citizen of Levant. Once you’ve introduced yourself to the Queen, it’s a done deal.
Ah, a visitor! Be sure to buy lots of things from the local shops, their prices are excellent, if I do say so myself!

Your face isn't familiar to me. You must be new to Levant. Welcome to the Heroic Kingdom, where our hope is to give every person the chance to do what they excel at, and the chance to live the life they wish to live.
I am King Simeon, and this is my Queen, Calixa. My gut tells me that you’re skilled in survival. I’m sure you’ll be a great asset as a mercenary.
We are constantly under threat by the beasts and bandits of the desert. If you can help us, we are overjoyed to have you.
Will you, [PlayerName], pledge your service to the ideals of the Heroic Kingdom of Levant? To help us create a place where humankind can do more than just survive?
I don’t think I’m the right person for this. Sorry.
I pledge myself to the Heroic Kingdom.
Excellent. The Heroic Kingdom of Levant is happy to have you, citizen. If you’re looking for work, I’m sure Cyrene has plenty that pays well.
That’s a shame. If you change your mind, the kingdom will be waiting.
(This is a turning point in my life... Am I certain I wish to pledge my life to the Heroic Kingdom of Levant?)
I am sorry, but unless you have official business here, I do not have the time to spare for a visitor.
Ah, so you must be the new one we’ve been informed about. Welcome to the Heroic Kingdom of Levant.
I’d enjoy swapping stories with you, traveler, but Calixa and I are discussing what should be done about the old Sand Rose Quarry. Perhaps later.
I apologize for my selection, but we’re, ummm, understocked on everything.
Don’t get your hopes up too much, there’s, ah... pretty large taxes on my goods.
If I could offer you a better deal, I would. But it’s out of my control, I’m afraid.
I’m sorry if the price of goods is a little higher than usual, it’s not something I have control over when selling goods in Levant.
Oh, well hello there, traveler. I hope you enjoy the sights and sounds of the Heroic Kingdom of Levant. I’m Kirouac. Alchemist, politician, and philosopher.

I’m the one who convinced King Simeon and Queen Calixa to declare Levant to be a nation outside the Blue Chamber’s laws. Not one of us regrets it. Here, anyone can be free to pursue their dreams without Tribal Laws restricting them!
Look out! There’s still criminals in here, you dolt!
Thank you! These damn criminal scum kidnapped me straight from the Blue Chamber and hauled me here in a sack!
Here, I have to reward you for this. I’ve got 100 silver on me, and by my Queen you deserve every last one of them! Now if you’ll excuse me, I need to get back to Berg and try to sort this mess out!
I'm sorry you woke up to that, after what you’ve been through, [PlayerName]. Please, forgive them. Many of them have lost family and aren't thinking straight.
I can't believe they want to seize my home! Can't you do something?

If I could do more, I would. But if you do not pay off those 4 months of missed payments on your own, the tribe will have my head. The most I can do for you is declare a mourning period and buy you a little time. For 5 days, no one in the tribe can ask for what you owe.
That gives you 5 days to pay back all 150 silver coins. Use your time to gather the money or earn a Tribal Favor. Then, they won't be able to do a thing to you.
Once you can make the payment, come see me up at the town hall on top of the hill. Please, find a way to make it work, [PlayerName]. The last thing I want to do is take your lighthouse away.
How can I earn a Tribal Favor so quickly?
One sailor is still missing. The current may have pushed him to the shore of the southern beach. If you bring him alive…well, the Tribe would owe you a great favor.
You're planning to use the tunnel under the lighthouse storage area to save time, aren't you? Make sure you're prepared for the outside world first if you do.
Someone saw Troglodytes in there last night. Also, once you leave those tunnels, you can’t use them to return to Cierzo.
I can't possibly accomplish that! I need more time!

A dozen people lost their lives in that shipwreck, leaving grieving kin behind. Their families need the assistance immediately. Their need outweighs yours. Trust me, [PlayerName], I wouldn’t be doing this to you otherwise.
You must find a way to pay what is owed to the tribe. The last thing I want to do is take your lighthouse away.
This Blood Price is unfair! You can't hold me responsible for things that are out of my control!

Have you forgotten why your family bears this Blood Price? When your grandmother was Chamberlady, she turned away the followers of Elatt in our time of greatest need, forcing the tribe to pray only to the Five Winds for protection.
Because of her pride, dozens were slain by the beasts of the Scourge. Your bloodline owes it to them to pay back that debt!
I understand. Bitterness still runs very deep in the tribe.
If you understand, then get to work making that payment, [PlayerName].
How could I possibly forget? Not a day goes by without someone reminding me!
You live and breathe thanks to the deeds of your ancestors. You cannot embrace such a gift if you cannot also bear the costs of their actions.
I can't bear this stupid Blood Price any longer. What if I just leave and never come back?
If you think you can survive alone, out there in the wild, you have that right. But remember, your tribe is your family. We achieve more together than we do on our own.
Then I will have to head outside the walls.
That does seem like your most effective option, dangerous as it is. I doubt you'd be able to gather that much in such a short time just by staying in Cierzo.
Never forget, no one is an orphan in Cierzo. Though you owe us a Blood Price, we will still help you however we can. Never hesitate to ask the rest of the tribe for survival advice.
If you can do a great deed for someone in Cierzo, we will owe you a Tribal Favor, which I will accept as a substitute for your payment.
Once you're ready to leave Cierzo, speak with Burac, the Gate Warden. He will judge whether or not you are prepared to face the outside world.
Remember, [PlayerName], you only have 5 days to pay me the 150 silver, or show me proof you have earned a Tribal Favor . May your ancestors watch over you.
Who would be able to help me?
Eto is the Kazite Trainer. He can teach you about combat. Burac, the gate warden, can teach you about surviving out in the wild. I’m sure the shopkeepers can teach you about their expertise as well.
[PlayerName], how go your efforts?
I want to talk about my Blood Price.
If you’re looking for news the Inn is always a good place to try, and don't forget about Yzan down by the beach!
I have questions about our tribe.
What do you wish to know?
What are your duties as Chamberlady? I never have paid much mind to politics.
I represent us within the Blue Chamber Collective, whenever the tribes need to make a decision that affects us all. Each of us bears one vote on the matters at hand.
Should a Chamberlord call a meeting, we gather in the city of Berg, the birthplace of our Collective, and hold a discussion, then a vote.

As such, I wield much power within the town of Cierzo, but only so long as my decisions are accepted. After all, your grandmother was Chamberlady once, before she was exiled for her actions. No one in the Collective is above the law.
You’re always trying to look after me. Why?

As children, your Father and I were close. I saw a future for us... but he could not stand by as the woman who would be your mother bore the weight of your grandmother's sins alone. There’s only so much a single huntress can manage.
They turned into a natural team, working to redeem your bloodline. I must admit, she was better suited for him... despite it all, we remained close friends.
You may not be connected to me by blood or tradition, but I still consider you family, [PlayerName]. I don’t want to see you suffer.
Enough talk about the past.
I’m on my way, farewell, Lady Aberdeen.
Ancestors guide you, [PlayerName]. Be safe. Be smart.
And on time, too! I'm impressed, [PlayerName]. You've proven you can be an excellent asset to the tribe when you put your mind to it.
I'll see that this money gets to the families that need it most. Thank you for your efforts.
Well done. Consider this payment dealt with. Cierzo thanks you for your great deed.
You have a way to make that payment, [PlayerName]? Show me.
I have 150 silver right here.
I earned a Tribal Favor.
[PlayerName], I'm afraid that you came too late. The lighthouse has been sold and is used by the guards as a barrack.
Come on! I worked like a dog to earn that money! This isn't fair!
If you cannot succeed at a task, then you must accept the price of failure. This is one of life's most important lessons.
Well, I tried.
That you did, [PlayerName]. Even though the payment was late, you've proven you can survive in Aurai.
Lesson learned, then. I need to be more efficient.
Indeed. The world will not wait for you. Either move at Aurai's pace, or you will be left behind.
Great, I'm homeless now. Thanks for nothing as usual, Rissa.
Bitterness won't do you any good. The world will not wait for you. Besides, you learned how to survive on your own, like a bird pushed from its nest.
Greetings, [PlayerName], how are you?
[PlayerName], I wish I could greet you with a smile, but... well, we both know that won’t happen. Elatt’s breath, what a disaster...
How are you holding up?
Yesterday I was leading our most ambitious expedition in a decade. Now all that's left is this wreck and a tribe in mourning. I’m not holding up much better than you are.
What happened? How did our ship sink so close to home?
The lighthouse wasn’t lit at the time we made impact with the rocks, I’m certain. I remember thinking that we should have seen it by now, right before we hit the rock.
We lost everyone below deck... Half the ship came apart before I was able to run aground.
Such is the way of the world...
Aye. And we can either bow to it, or rise against it. I know which one I'd rather do.
So we lost everything? All the coins? The spices? The armor and weapons?
Unfortunately, yes. What little we could salvage from the wreck has gone to the families of my drowned men. My finances are reeling from this loss. I have barely enough left to start over.
Still, we have no right to complain. All we lost was some coin and four months of time on this failed journey. My sailors lost their lives.
Of course. Their families need all the help they can get right now.
Kind as ever, [PlayerName]. Even struggling with your own problems, you still open your heart to those in need. Your parents would be proud.
Yzan, I have 5 days to gather 150 silver. Or I lose my home.
How much?! Damn, that’s right, you haven't been able to make payments on your Blood Price while we were gone. You always get the short end of the stick, don't you?
This Blood Price on your head is disgusting. It's unfair to hold anyone responsible for the crimes of their ancestors. You weren't even born when that tragedy happened!
I welcome the challenge. Besides, it's an excuse to get out there and find adventure.
More like find an early grave and lose a leg. “What doesn't kill you makes you stronger”? My prosthetic arm and leg are a testament to how stupid that sentiment is.
Suffering doesn’t help anyone. Any system that forces pain upon anyone innocent has no right to exist. I often wonder if we're alive because of our tribal laws, or in spite of them.
I know. But I don't have a choice.
Of course you do. Your life is your own. You choose what to do and where to go. Just because a choice is hard doesn't mean you can't take it.
I'm sorry I don't have better news, [PlayerName]. Well, I guess it's up to us to pick up the pieces. Best of luck with squaring things with Rissa in the short term.
I guess I truly am on my own, then...

Actually... I do have a small stash of goods I hid, in case of disaster. I hid it near the old shipwreck to the South. When you open it, remember that the Moon Commands the Stars. You'll know what I mean.
Remember, take care of yourself and don’t be a tool for others, or you’ll end with missing limbs like me. Make your own path.
I want my money back. Hand it over or I'll beat it out of you.
Wait, you're mugging me, [PlayerName]?! The last person in this place that really gives a damn about you? After all the crap we just went through?!
Yeah. I'm mugging you. Now give me what you owe me!
Fine! This is all I have, unless you're interested in a little fishing boat that you don't know how to steer. Take my 25 silver and buy yourself some decency. Get lost, [PlayerName].
I'm sorry, that wasn’t a funny joke.
On any other day, it’d have laughed. But I lost a dozen sailors in this accident. I'm no mood for pranks.
I’ve got work to do, [PlayerName]. But it was good talking to my last friend in this damn town.
Get lost. We're through, [PlayerName].
May Elatt watch over you, [PlayerName]. Can I help you?
Anything I should avoid outside of Cierzo?
Well, for one thing, be wary on the beaches outside. An encounter with a pistol shrimp may prove deadly. There's a reason they're so colorful, it’s to warn other predators away!
Not only are they nasty up close, they boast a deadly ranged attack as well. It’s charged with lightning, so use potions and armor that resist this type of attack if you fight one.
The Chersonese has game animals and plenty of trees for wood. Its water, however, has to be boiled first. Fill your Waterskin at the Water Purifier on the village beach before you head out.
You're a priest of Elatt, right? What can you tell me about him?

As a human, he was far from perfect. He was supposedly brash and full of himself in his younger years. But he strove to improve himself day by day, and founded the Tribe Without Name, governed by the 3 Pillars the Holy Mission still follows.
Then came the Scourge. Elatt, being a master of Magic, sacrificed his very humanity and became Living Thought, guiding us to the uneasy stalemate we’ve known for most of this century.

The Five Winds we once prayed to were capricious. Elatt however... I’ve had the honor of speaking with him. He is very real. Having a god that was once mortal is comforting. He remembers what it was like to wear flesh like we do.
See you Rufus, I have to go.
[PlayerName], always a pleasure! What do you want?
I may have something for you.
Glad to hear that. What do you have?
I'll leave you to your work, thanks for the chat.
Look after yourself, [PlayerName].
I’m looking for work.
I’m looking for something I can do nearby.
Got any more dangerous work for me?
I have something to sell.
I have this unusual item...
I’m here about work.
I found that rare mushroom you wanted!
As a matter of fact, I could use a brash explorer for something. Tell me, what will you risk for some silver?
If the pay’s good, I'm willing to put my life in danger.
I’m not risking my life for coins, if that's what you're asking.
Fair enough. It is a good thing to understand your boundaries. If you find rare items, my coin purse is always open!
I’m looking for a particularly rare mushroom in the shape of a shield. I hear it grows in Blister Burrow, north-east of Cierzo.
You’ll know it if you find it. The primary characteristics are its immense size and red color. Bring me that mushroom and I’ll pay 70 silver for it.
That payment, plus whatever you loot and sell along the way, should be enough to cover your Blood Price. Just be careful in there, that cave is a Troglodyte breeding ground.
Troglodytes and deep dark caves? That sounds like a terrible idea. Pass!
And now you see why I don't want to go either. We are both smarter than we look!
What kind of properties does this mushroom have?
That's a trade secret, [PlayerName]. Maybe I'll tell you later. Are you interested, or not?
Sounds like an adventure. I'll do it!

Perfect! Make sure you have a good weapon, a lantern, and plenty of supplies. It’s a dangerous cave, and you will be putting your life on the line. Don't forget that Trogs have poor eyesight, but fantastic hearing.
To get to Blister Burrow, head out of Cierzo’s main gate, then follow the road to the left. When you get to another fork in the road at a wooden gate, turn left again.
You'll know you're going the right way if you see crude statues made by the troglodytes. The entrance should be just ahead of you, along the hillside.
Anything else?
Ah! That’s what I’m looking for! Thank you, [PlayerName]! You’ve more than earned your reward!
I’m always interested in curiosities. What have you got?
I found this strange garnet in the ribcage of an Ash Giant.
Oho, an interesting piece. I’ll give you 30 silver for that.
Really, only 30? I could get a better price with the Ash Giants for returning this stone, I’m sure.
You drive a hard bargain, my friend. I’ll give you 50 silver, and not a single one more!
No deal.
No deal then. Please reconsider the offer.
Deal, here you go.
A good deal for both of us.
Excellent. A pleasure doing business as always!
At that price, I’ll keep it.
Work, eh? What do you need?
Actually, I don’t think I have anything that’ll interest you, sorry.
Don’t get a lady’s hopes like that! It’s not nice!
I’m all ears, what can you tell me?
I found this strange bullet that someone killed Zephyrien with. Do you know what this is?
I found this very beautiful Halberd. Interested?
Let me see that bullet! Oh my. I... can’t really tell much about it without tools, but... whoever designed this was a tremendously cruel person, and very prepared.

The casing itself is made from carefully forged Tsar Stone. I don’t think it’s possible to get that material back into usable form, though, not with that black poison goop all over it... Tell you what, I’ll buy this off you for 60 silver.
Mofat told me that the poison is distilled blood from an Immaculate. Only the Sorobor Academy would be able to refine something this dangerous.

Did he? He must have been mistaken. Sorobor Academy doesn’t do business with those monsters, and we certainly had no motive to see Zephyrien assassinated. Still... If it is Immaculate’s blood... How does 100 silver for the bullet sound?
I’m with the Holy Mission. I can’t let this get swept under the rug. This needs to be investigated!

Trust me, [PlayerName], I don’t think it’s possible for anyone to find the truth of the matter from outside of our organization. We’re too good at keeping secrets. Give it to me and I’ll take care of it. How does 120 silver interest you?
I don’t want your hush money! I’m keeping this bullet!
Let me see that halberd... Excellent craftsmanship! I know warriors that’d be interested in this. I’ll give you more silver for it than any merchant in Aurai!
Considering Sorobor’s recent scandal with those missing missionaries, I’m not sure handing this over is a good idea.

Ah, yes, heard about that incident. Justice has been served and the people responsible have been dealt with, so I can assure you, giving this to me is quite safe. Of course, I could increase my price to 100 silver... What do you say?
I'm glad you survived the wreck, [PlayerName]. And I'm sorry about your losses. I know how much you were counting on this expedition.
That glowing sword is new. When did you get it?
Rufus commissioned it for me as a going away present. I was going to leave this morning to go join the Holy Mission of Elatt before Mother could stop me.
But with the shipwreck... It wouldn't be right to leave. I have to stay with the tribe until the mourning period is over.
I can't imagine your mother will let you go without another lecture.
I know. Rissa already promised that the second she isn't drowning in important matters, she and I will be having a long talk.
I hope she convinces you. I'll miss you if you leave.
I know. I'll miss you and Yzan too. But this is the path I choose to walk. I'm done letting Rissa decide my life. I want to be part of the greater good, not rule over people.
You should just go now. You're abandoning your name and home anyway. Forget staying for the mourning period.

I would, but... Cierzo's still my home. I can't just leave when it's in such pain. As soon as the mourning period is over, though, I'm leaving. No matter what Mother says. I have delayed for too long already.
You have no idea... I don’t know how I’m going to gather the money Rissa is demanding from me.
I have faith in you, [PlayerName]. You'll pull through. If you can survive such a lethal shipwreck, I'm certain you can make your next Blood Price Payment.
Go, now. We both have work to do, for Cierzo's sake.
Nice to see you, [PlayerName]. You have nothing to fear while I’m around, my friend.
Oh. [PlayerName]. What brings you here? How's my brother doing?
Well, Yzan's alive. That's more than most of the other people on our expedition can say.
Y-yeah, shame about the shipwreck. Accidents like this happen all the time.
Not if the lighthouse is lit. Who was on duty that night?
Not a clue. I’m not the one organizing things around here. Wasn’t me though, that’s for sure.
Well, the bay is pretty dangerous. If it keeps the pirates away, then I guess it's dangerous to our ships too.
Exactly! If my brother had a smaller ship, or you guys hadn't picked up so many Kazite rugs or whatever else in Oroshi, you wouldn't have had any trouble!
Shouldn't you be helping your brother salvage the wreck?
I don't think he wants my help. He's always says that I'm stupid and clumsy. I'd probably just get in the way. Ugh, this is the worst day I've had in forever.
Rise and shine, Trog spawn! You think you can nip off for four months and not pay what you owe the tribe?
A Blood Price is sacred, [PlayerName], you can't just shrug off that responsibility for as long as you did!
If I don't see the money from you by the time I count to ten, I will make sure you regret ever coming home!
I just woke up from a shipwreck! Have a heart, will you?
You know I can't pay it! All the money we made in Oroshi is at the bottom of the bay!
Yeah, you were on that ship too, weren't you? How do I know you're not at fault? I lost my daughter on that voyage! You bring ruin to the tribe just like your grandmother!
This doesn't change the fact that I have no money right now and can't pay you.
Stop this right now. You're being unreasonable. Don't make this violent.
If you can't make the payments you missed, we'll seize your home. That ought to cover four months of ignoring your duty to the tribe! Either pay up, or get out of our way!
Enough of this! Twelve people are dead. This is a time for the tribe to come together and mourn our lost loved ones, not to demand payment from a survivor! Stop this shameful behaviour at once!
[PlayerName] is a victim of that shipwreck too. Under the laws of the Blue Chamber Collective, I have declared a period of mourning. You understand what that means, don't you?
But Chamberlady Aberdeen! [PlayerName] has clearly been-
I said, that is enough! If you want to take this back up with [PlayerName] after the mourning period, feel free. But until then, your concern should be for those whose lives were lost in the wreck.
Oliele, see these people off, would you?
You heard Mother. Away with you. Leave [PlayerName] be, or I will personally see to it that you get double shifts of guard duty this month!
(This corpse bears the uniform of one of Cierzo`s sailors... The wounds suggest that the pistol shrimps got him...)
Thank you again, [PlayerName]! I'll find someplace to recover, then I'll come running home singing your praises! I'll never forget this!
I can't... I can't move... A pistol shrimp got me... I think it tore a hole in my gut... Help... please! Before it comes back!
I don’t have anything that can help. I'll look for something, hang on!
Open your mouth, I have a potion I can use! (Give a health potion.)
Open up, this drink will help you. (Give Gep’s Drink.)
Hold still, I have a bandage! (Give a Bandage.)
Please... hurry... I don't know how long I have...
I... can feel it working... Thank Elatt! I'm not going to die here!
What... did you just give me? I need medicine, not... Oh wow. My vision is already clearing up! Whatever that was, it's incredible!
Oh! It's you, [PlayerName]! Thank you! A million times thank you! I seriously owe you one! I'll talk to Aunt Rissa, and make sure you get a full Tribal Favor for this!
Ow... I don't think I'm fit to run back home just yet. I'll go find a safe place to let that medicine do its thing, then go home the second I'm able.
Hello there. I’m just mentoring this smith. He’s good at what he does, but a little help from me will push him to greatness!
Don’t mind the lines of light all over. That happens when you reach the rank of Disciple in the Holy Mission. With these, I can resist and destroy Corruption with my very body!

Hmph, you look tough enough. How’s the outside world, adventurer? It’s been years since I left Abrassar. Mother thinks I’m an embarrassment at major meetings. Why don’t you tell me all about your travels sometime over drinks, on me?

I’m afraid I don’t have time for you. I have a lot on my mind. Being next in line for the throne is a full-time job. I have to be completely up to date on everything that could affect the Kingdom, and I have to watch my back at all times. It’s exhausting.
[PlayerName]! You're alive! You must be freezing. Come, warm up by the fire, before you freeze to death!
You look like you’re about to collapse from thirst. There’s a clean spring by the broken bridge you just crossed. Have a drink before you faint!
You found some rags on the beach? Good. Wear them. They’ll keep you warmer than nothing!
You’ll catch a cold if you wander around without any clothes. Here, they’re not much, but wear them.
Where are we, Yzan? The last thing I remember was our ship hitting a rock...
We're not far from home. You can see the lighthouse from here, can't you? Eto made it out too, he's making his way home to Cierzo to go get help.
Eto made it out alive too? Thank Elatt.
He’s a Kazite, [PlayerName], he was born on a ship. This probably isn’t the first time he’s had to survive a shipwreck.
One of my men went to look for survivors out near that arch. He hasn't come back yet... I'm worried he might have run into hyenas. If you're well enough, can you look for him?
If you’re still feeling too injured from the shipwreck, go ahead and sleep in one of the bedrolls I laid out, and I’ll keep watch for Eto and rescuers.
You look half-starved! Help yourself to the bread in the basket behind me. There's also plenty of Gaberries growing around here if you’re still hungry afterwards.
“If you survived the wreck, meet me on the hill ahead, I’m setting up a camp for us. I'll try to leave essentials next to these markers.”
“Dry up and stay warm with these rags. The cold could kill you if you don't bundle up.”
“I've left a waterskin if you need water. There's clean water around here if you need to refill it.”
“If you’re injured, there's a bandage for you. You can make more from Linen Cloths.”

“[InputAction_LockToggle] to lock on a target. [InputAction_Attack1] for attacks. [InputAction_Attack2] for heavy attacks. Tap [InputAction_Dodge] to dodge, hold to run. [InputAction_Block] to block.”
Can you teach me how to fight?
What do you want me to teach you?
How do I focus on my targets?
Lock on enemies to circle around them in melee or to attack foes with bows or spells.
How do I actually fight?
You can combo attacks. Heavy attacks are slower but stronger. Performing a heavy attack at different points in a combo performs different attacks. Attacks take stamina to perform.
What’s the best way to prevent taking hits from enemies?
When the enemy bears down on you, dodge to get out of harm's way. If your foe is quick, you may want to drop your backpack. Most backpacks slow down your roll.
Blocking will protect you from enemy physical attacks, but every hit you block will consume stamina. To block projectiles, you must use a shield. Against magical explosions, you will need to dodge.
If you need to get into a better position or to flee, sprint away. Take care not to run for too long, or you will be too exhausted to fight.
How should I protect myself?
Some foes will do more than just strike at you with swords or claws. They might harm you with ice, fire, lightning or more. Wear equipment that resists the type of damage they inflict.

Every blow you take will destabilize you. If you take too many hits in a short time, you may be knocked off your feet. If you are being harried too hard, try to get some distance from your foe and regain your footing.
Likewise, if you manage to make your opponent stumble, press your advantage. Blunt weapons are an excellent choice to use this strategy.
How do I sneak around unseen?

First, you’ll have better chance of avoiding attention if you’re in the dark. Then, put out any lit lanterns or torches and crouch down. Stay out of your enemy’s vision, and either sneak past them, or carefully approach them to attack.
You can use this stealthy approach to set up traps for your enemies, or to get the first strike with a melee weapon, or to backstab them if you’ve learned the right dagger skill.
Traps are powerful when you bait enemies into them. First, you need a trigger device like a tripwire, then you need to arm it with a compatible item like iron spikes.
You’re a healer, right? What should I be worried about in the wild?
Do you have any specific questions?
What short term situations could make me lose the edge in a fight?
Many foes will infect you with temporary effects. These effects go away over time, although many can be cured with the right items.
For example, if you are bleeding and losing health, a bandage will stop the bleeding and heal you for a short while.
What do I do if I catch a disease?

You can brew or buy various types of tea to begin the recovery process. To make your own in the wild, you’ll need the ingredients and a cooking pot, though. After drinking, you’ll need some time before the illness is actually cured.

If those options are unavailable, just rest for a long time. Have lots of water, sleep and food, and eventually you will beat back the disease. Depending on what you caught, it may take several days before you are well again.
Can you teach me about how to eat well, while I’m in the wild?
I’ve got you covered. What’s on your mind?
I’m not sure how to find food out there.

On top of hunting, you can forage for food. Pick Gaberries from bushes or use a Fishing Harpoon at a fishing spot. Cook any raw meat and boil any water that isn't "clean" before eating. You don't want to get sick.
What’s a quick and easy way to cook?
Simple food can be cooked on a lit campfire. Cooked food rots slower and fills you up more. You can even boil River Water to turn it into Clean Water that is free of disease.
I want to try my hand at more advanced dishes.

If you deploy a cooking pot over a campfire, or if you have a home with a proper kitchen, you’ll be able to cook recipes with more than one ingredient. They’ll be even more filling and often have special properties. A good meal before a fight will tilt the odds in your favor.
Can you teach me about magic?
I could wax poetic about it all day. What’s got your curiosity?
What actually is Mana, and how do you control it?
Mana is energy that flows through everything. Plants, animals, people, even rocks. Mages are those who’ve learned how to capture that energy and unleash it in the form of magic spells.
Magic is something that requires patience to master. By combining spells in the right sequence, you will achieve better results than using a spell on its own.
Where can I learn magic?

To unlock the secret of Mana, you must travel to a Ley Line, a place where Aurai's life flows strong. The nearest one is the one under the Conflux Mountain. You know it, right? The large purple mountain in the Chersonese.
The Holy Mission and the Kingdom of Levant have their own paths into the Conflux Mountain as well, and each one will test you differently. They’ll all lead to the main chamber.
What do I need to learn to survive in the wild?
What’s got you worried?
I’ve noticed that the longer I stay out, the less maximum health and stamina I have.
Pay attention to what your body tells you. As you push yourself, your maximum reserves of Health and Stamina will be diminished, and you'll only have a fraction of your maximum.

Sleeping in a tent or a bed will restore your reserves of Stamina and Health. Always be mindful of your limits and don't push them more than you need. There is no shame in taking time to set up camp when you are exhausted.
How important is it to eat, drink and sleep?
Your body has needs. Hunger, thirst and exhaustion are persistent foes, so eat and drink when you need to. With a little preparation, you will find it easy enough to take care of yourself.
Rest is the best remedy for a wounded body. If your reserves of Health and Stamina are diminished or you are gravely injured, it’s a good idea to rest in a bedroll or a tent.
If you're near civilization, a night at the inn will take care of your needs. It will cost a handful of silver, though.
How do I deal with dangerous temperatures?

Be mindful of the weather and climate you travel in. When the cold rolls in, you should dress warmly and use campfires or torches for warmth. If you stay cold for too long you may get sick, and eventually freeze to death.
Greetings, [PlayerName]. Is something the matter?
What can you tell me about handling equipment?
Quite a lot. Tell me what you want to know.
What’s more effective? One-handed weapons, or two-handed?
It depends on your situation. Weapons that need two hands are often stronger and have superior reach, but one handed weapons allow you to carry trinkets like shields or lanterns in your off-hand.
How do I use a bow?
The simplest way to ensure damage at range is a good bow and some arrows. Keep a good supply of arrows equipped, and craft more arrows if you run low.
To shoot arrows, hold, then release the bowstring. Locking on enemies is useful with bows. For precision shots, you can even zoom in.
Why are shields useful?
Use a shield to consume less of your stamina and stability when blocking enemy physical attacks. Shields block projectiles, but not explosions.
How do I maintain my equipment durability?
Your equipment will be worn down with time and use. You can still use a broken piece of equipment if you need to, but it will be far less effective than if it was well-maintained.

To repair your gear, dedicate time to it when you set up camp. It’ll only repair what’s equipped on you, so it’ll take several rest periods to repair other weapons or armor you keep for special situations.
Can you teach me about crafting and managing my inventory?
Sure, what do you want to know?
Can you teach me about survival crafting?
Whenever you need to, you can craft a great variety of items to aid in your survival. For example, some wood and linen cloth can be made into a torch if you need light.
Not only can you assemble things like tents, backpacks and weapons out of raw materials, you can also disassemble many items like clothes or weapons to get materials.
Using what your environment provides you, either through experimentation or learning crafting recipes, is the difference between a lost wanderer and an expert explorer.
How useful is it to have a backpack?

The backpack is one of the most essential tools for any traveller. You’ll be able to carry more before you are over encumbered, and you can hang a lantern from most backpacks, freeing both your hands when exploring dark caves.
If you get into a fight, however, it's usually best to drop the bag. You see, backpacks slow down your dodge.
Oh, and a word of caution. Should your backpack be hit, it’ll damage the items inside. Food, weapons and armor pieces in your pack can be damaged this way.
What’s a good way to handle my inventory?
Keep only what you can't live without in your pockets, and store your camp gear and loot in your backpack. This will keep you light on your feet and more effective in a fight.
Learning how to effectively split your gear between backpack and pockets is essential. You don't want to find yourself without bandages at a bad time, and you don't want to be overburdened either.
While wearing a backpack, what you pick up goes in the backpack. Consider setting items you use often, like bandages, to quickslots to have them ready during combat.
Welcome. I am a Watcher of the Ley Line. Do you have questions about the art of magic, visitor?
What actually is Mana, and how do you control it?

Mana is the energy that is the flows through all things. With proper preparation, you may use it to force the world to bend to your will by casting spells. Alone, most spells are weak, but when combined or used in the right ritual sequence, their power is made manifest.

You can rest to recharge mana, but be warned. Your maximum capacity for Mana can only be maintained with rigid focus. If you sleep, it will take time before you will be able to call upon your full reserves of Mana again. A sleeping mind loses its connection to the real world, after all.
Can you teach me magic?

To unlock the power of mana, you must give up some of your mortal vitality to a Ley Line, a place where Aurai's life flows strong, like this very chamber. If you wish to become a mage, touch the crystal at the center of the chamber.
The Holy Mission and the Kingdom of Levant have their own paths to this chamber, so if you wish to return here, you could take their particular path to get back here in a different manner.
I notice that most mages don’t wear heavy helmets, why not?
To cast spells frequently, I’d advise you to wear light headgear so it won’t interfere with your body's flow of Mana. Heavy helmets limit your capacity to cast spells.

If you wish to recharge your reserves of Mana, having a meal will help, especially a certain blue vegetable that... Honestly I’ve gotten a little sick of eating so often. You can also pull Mana from lingering souls, with the right technique.
Now that mana flows through your veins, I can teach you a new spell to welcome you as a mage.
Teach me how to cast a Fire Sigil.
Teach me how to Reveal Souls.
So, you have come. I sensed that someone who had the potential for magic was on their way
If you wish to gain Magic, you must first give. You must sacrifice Health and Stamina to the Ley Line, and in return what you gave up will be given back to you as Mana.
Be careful how much of your Health and Stamina you give up, because once you have traded it for Mana, you can never get it back.
The first time you gain Mana, you will gain your first spell, the Spark. It may seem small and weak, but when combined with other spells or components, it can produce powerful effects.
Welcome, mage. May your talent for magic only grow stronger.
Never underestimate the humble Spark spell. It may seem small and weak, but when combined with other spells or components, it can produce powerful effects.
If you feel that your current reserves of Mana are insufficient, you may still offer up your health and stamina to the Ley Line for more power, but never forget that the exchange is permanent.

If you wish to learn the most complex of spells, seek out Rune Magic in Berg. Only by properly combining them will you unlock their power. They are spells that require experimentation, but are flexible once you understand them.

Magic is the weapon of a patient warrior. You cannot charge into danger and unleash spells as you please. You must plan your attacks, and bring enemies into a fight that is to your advantage. Never forget that spells must be used in the right combination.
Feel free to use one of our boats to return to the surface when your business here is concluded. It will take you to a beach not far from Cierzo.
Welcome. Bow your head in respect, for you have come to the end of a Ley Line. The place where the very world itself will pour its power into you, if you make room for it.
To open yourself to Mana is to open yourself to the flow of our world. To use magic is to command the world to obey your desires. Master magic, and you master the flow that echoes through us all.
If you are prepared to sacrifice some of yourself for it, and you are prepared to miss many nights of sleep, we welcome you. May the power of Mana lead you on the road to success.
Hold up there, [PlayerName]! Where do you think you’re going?
I’m going outside.
Not like that you aren't! You need at least an equipped weapon, a waterskin and an equipped backpack before you're ready to face the outside world.
If I let you adventure outside without even the most basic of equipment, you'd be marching to your own death!
If you're pressed to find a weapon, make yourself a quarterstaff from some tree wood. You can also craft a backpack, although I'm sure you have one lying around at home.
But I need to get out! My life depends on it!
Alright. I'll make sure I'm prepared before I head out.
And I can't let you out in this state. Your life also depends on it!

Come back when you're seriously ready. And don't even think about using the storage tunnel under the lighthouse to sneak out! There's a pair of Troglodytes in there that we haven't had time to put down!
I'm also sure you can find a spare waterskin by the Water Purifier at the town beach. Don't forget to fill it up while you're there!
What can you tell me about the Chersonese Region?
There's several packs of hyenas to the north that are muscling into our hunting grounds. There are some nasty Troglodytes in the area too. I suspect they're jockeying for territory and prey.
Stay far away from the north-east in particular. I've heard rumors of a Scourge Beast, a shell horror specifically, near the Ghost Pass. It’s probably just a rumor, but better safe than sorry, I say.
Don't forget that two other tribes are in open hostility to us right now. Be wary of the Montcalm tribe in the north and the Kazite pirates near the coast.
Then there's the matter of several bandit crews deciding to join forces in the Vendavel fortress along the southern coast. Stay well away from it. They will enslave you if they capture you.
What are you up to, Warden?
Waiting on some scouts to come back from reconnaissance. Up to date information on what’s happening in the surrounding region is essential to keeping Cierzo safe.
There's a bandit group I suspect is planning to attack us, and I want us to be prepared. I may be a skilled warrior, but against two dozen foes even I would be swept aside.
My warriors and I are the last line of defense for Cierzo. We decide what enters and what is driven from our walls. We bear the heaviest responsibility in this tribe.
Well, you’ve got the essentials at least. Here, I'll teach you a skill. Mastering these is the key to survival out in the wild. Want me to teach you one for the weapon you’re currently holding?

There you go! Mastering skills like this one is the key to survival out in the wild. You should look for Trainers whenever you visit a new town. They usually group near training equipment. Others need to be sought out.
I think I want to learn one for a different weapon, give me a minute Burac.
Alright, I’ll let you go outside the town’s walls. Use the gate whenever you want to head out. Stay safe out there.
Ah, [PlayerName], I am glad that you're back. We need all the help we can get. The Fortress of Vendavel has become a threat we can't ignore!
I hope I can count on your help dealing with the fortress of Vendavel. It remains a deadly threat to Cierzo.

When it was just squatting bandits, it was bad enough. Now we know that 3 warlords have begun to order them into an army. I think they mean to attack Cierzo. If they do... I don't know if we can hold them off.
What do you recommend we do?
I honestly don't know. If we send any kind of force to go attack the fortress, we risk stirring the hornet's nest…If only if we could separate and deal with the Warlords one at a time...
It would be very dangerous to infiltrate the fortress. Use discretion and caution. Messing with Vendavel might get you imprisoned, enslaved, or worse.
Do you know who is organizing them?
I’ll take care of it.
One is a former warrior of mine, Crock. Exiled after he murdered two of my men in a drunken brawl. Another is a Kazite pirate captain even Eto is wary about... I think they know each other.
And lastly, there’s a mage who used to be part of one of Harmattan’s tribes. All 3 of them need to be dealt with. If you have to, kill them. They’re that much of a threat.
My men tell me that Vendavel has gotten a lot quieter. I don’t want to think about the disaster that would have hit! On behalf of all of Cierzo, I thank you.

Say, you were the one who sent Crock out here to challenge me, weren't you? Very smart move. A single drunkard like that was no threat to me. I’ve locked him in a cell below the town hall. Once Rissa comes back, we’ll decide what to do with him.
My men tell me that Vendavel has gotten a lot quieter. On behalf of all of Cierzo, I thank you. I do not want to think about the disaster what would have hit us if you hadn’t!
Remember that the Fortress of Vendavel is a threat to the very existence of Cierzo. Be careful, [PlayerName].
And what did you want to talk about?
I want to talk about Vendavel.
I want to talk about your work and the Chersonese in general.
What do you want to know?
Here, I feel I can trust you with the key to Cierzo. It’ll open up anything you like in town, including the vault in the Chamberlady’s town hall.

Amba, friend [PlayerName]. The threat of the Vendavel has me very worried. I would go to take care of them, but... I think one of those warlords, the Kazite... I think I know who it is. He would recognize me and kill me before I even got inside.
I want to do something about Vendavel too, where is it?
It's the old fortress on the beach to the south-west of the Chersonese.
Is there a safe way to get inside?

I think so... Bring me 3 iron scraps and some Blue Sand and I can modify one of my Kazite masks to fit you. If you cover your face with it, and say the right words, you may convince the gatekeepers that you are one of them.
I found what you’ll need to modify the mask, Eto.
Ah! Perfect. Wait for a moment, it will not take long.

It should fit you now. Make sure you wear this before you try to talk to the guards. If he is a Kazite pirate too, it is important to greet him with the word “Nindiria”. It roughly means sea-brother. And try to speak like me, yes?
About the warlord you said you know in Vendavel...
Yes? You have news of him?
It’s your uncle... He said he is only attacking Cierzo to get revenge. If you turn yourself in to him right away, he will leave Cierzo alone for good.
AIE! I knew it... That Nanzome... That Black Heart... He would kill so many just to punish me? Then, if my life will buy the lives of all of Cierzo, I will give it to him.
Don’t go, I’ll kill the bastard myself. Just stay safe until then.
I’m sorry, Eto...
Do not be. Actions always have consequences. I knew this may happen the moment I took up my sword against him. But I have no regrets. It was good to know you, [PlayerName]. Take care of yourself.
It's... Nevermind.
You were wrong, no one there knows you. It's safe for you to sneak in.
You are... sure? I trust you, [PlayerName]. If you say it is safe, then I will go infiltrate the fortress. I will see you very soon, with the warlords here in chains!
If you think you can stop him... then I will stay here. Cejo murio tapame amba. Best of luck, my friend.
Amba, friend [PlayerName]! I heard you destroyed the warlords of Vendavel! Perhaps I should call you the champion of Cierzo, now!
Yes, if you wear a mask like a Kazite, and say the right words, you should be able to pretend that you are one of them.
Do you know a Mage named Balira? I'm looking for her husband.

I know her, she was an apprentice of mine. Then, she twisted the gifts of the Five Winds to perform forbidden and horrible magic. Manipulating a person's Inside Wind, no matter the reason, is a violation of a person's most sacred boundary.
I told her she was never to come here again after what she did. And yet... although I cannot forgive her sacrilege, it's time to set aside this tragedy.

The man... or rather, what's left of the man you're looking for is hiding in the old broken tombs within this valley. He, or rather, "it" lives in the frozen cavern at the mouth of it. Put an end to its misery, and break their connection.
You’re not one of my warriors... You’re from Ciezo, I can tell. Make your case quickly, before I decide to have you locked up with the others!
I'm here to kill you.
I'd like to see you try. Attack the intruder, men!
I want you to call off your war against Cierzo.

Why should I do that? Cierzo bears some responsibility for what happened to me. Although... there is one thing you can do that could make me reconsider. I need you to kill someone for me. My former husband.
I’m not killing a man I don’t know.
Go on.

My mother arranged our marriage when I was young, she said it would benefit both our own tribe and Cierzo. He was... cruel when no one looked, and seemed incapable of realizing the harm he caused. In an attempt to make him understand, I tried something drastic.

I used magic I learned from the Cabal of Winds to twist our Inside Winds, our spirits, together. It only made things worse. He could sense my fear of him, and it drove him mad. He set fire to our home and fled into the night.
Because our spirits are still twisted together, if he senses me coming to find him, he will flee from me. I need someone else to put him down and end this horrid bond between us.
Where do I start looking?
The bastard’s hiding in the Chersonese, in the valley beyond Ghost Pass. He’s made his den in the Corrupted Tombs. I can sense cold ice all around him.
Track him down and kill him. He's nothing but a monster now, in every sense of the word. His nightmarish thoughts haunt me even now.
I can sense my late husband's Mana clinging to your very skin, and his monstrous thoughts no longer fill my dreams. Thank you. Tell me, what had happened to him?
He had become a Wendigo.
I thought as much. Thank you for ending this nightmare. Cierzo has repaid its debt to me. I no longer have a quarrel with them.
Begone, we have no further business.
Then you’re a trespasser. Guards! To prison with this one!
You are not one of mine. I can tell. You’re no Kazite pirate. What makes you dare to stand before Rospa Akiyuki?
Who are you, and why do you dare stand before Rospa Akiyuki?

Aho! You care for that bundle of huts, do you? Maybe I'll make you watch as I burn it to the ground. My Nanzome of a nephew betrayed us for those land-loving ghost-men. So long as Eto Akiyuki lives, my fury will know no quiet.

You want me to call off the destruction of Cierzo? Then bring that Nanzome, that black heart traitor, to me. Give me Eto’s life, and I will give you the lives of the worthless ash-faces in that tiny village!
If you agree, I will let you leave to bring him here. Send him here within 1 day, or I will make you pay!
There's no way I'd make that deal.
Then you will only be useful to me as a slave!
Eto's life for the lives of everyone in Cierzo? That's not a bad deal.
Good. Then, I will let you go. Remember, send Eto here within one day, or else!
Hyah, you think you can mess with Rospa Akiyuki? Then you die. ARCHERS! Fill him with arrows until his blood stains the floor!

Ah, Amba, my nandipame friend. You brought me Eto's head. I made him pay. I made him scream. I am no Nanzome, I honor my word and my bonds. I have no love for Cierzo, but I will spare it even so. My fury is satisfied... For now.
Why do you remain? I am no Nanzome, like Eto. My Kazite honor is solid like stone. I have no business against Cierzo... for now.
Nothing, I’m sorry I bothered you.
You can’t just go where you don’t belong and walk away. You either come quietly, or I beat you until you nandipame and arimbome!
I’m sorry, I’ll take care of it.
I’ve changed my mind, I’m not going to let you kill Eto.
You came back without Eto! My patience is very thin! You come back to prisons quietly, or I will take out my fury for Eto on you!
I’ll come quietly.
Not today!
Well now, what do we have here? A lost traveller? Come, warm yourself up inside! We'll take good care of you!
I'm just passing by.
What? But we have everything you need inside! We have food, water and treasure! Come on in!
Sure, sounds good.
Good, follow me and behave yourself. We could always use more people to handle our work...
I'll pass, thanks.
No, no, I think you’re sick! You need to see our medic right away! I insist!
I’m looking for a place to rest for a while.
Then you’ve come to the right place! We have plenty of free rooms for weary travellers!
Just looking for someone to have a drink with.
Ah, someone who speaks my language! What do you have for us to drink?
Just some water, sadly.
Tea, obviously.
Uhh... Nothing, I was hoping you'd offer me a drink.
Bah, we have plenty swill inside. Say, why don't I show you? Come inside with me and I’ll show you!
Oh. Well, sure! We have plenty of things to drink here, come with me and I'll show you!
I have a bottle of Gaberry Wine, actually.
*sniff* *sniff* Oh this smells like the good stuff.
R'oh man that was the best booze I've had in... well, since being exiled. I feel like I could take on anyone and win!
Anyone? Even me?
HAH! Challenge accepted! Let's get bloody, friend!
Anyone? Even someone like Burac, the warden of Cierzo?
That damn Burac, kicking me out like he did... When we come attack Cierzo, I'm gonna get 'im and put his head on a plaque! He can’t stop a whole army!
Why wait? Clearly you're a match for him alone, right?
Yeah... you’re right! Here, hold the fort while I’m gone! JUST YOU WAIT BURAC! I'M COMING FOR YOU!
No, I don’t wanna! And I wanna headbutt your head into the wall for even sayin' that!
Well, I'll be on my way.
Awww... So soon? Alright, you just come back when you have more of this stuff, it's real good!
Oh good, the entertainment has arrived. Put 'em up, you little twig!
Hey, wait a minute... I remember you, what are you doing back here?
I’m feelin’ a little too drunk right now....Ya mind comin’ back some other time?
Help an old lady? I can't stomach those pasty mushroom bars that the cook gives us for food. I haven't had egg in forever... Can you make me a Miner's Omelet? I’ll reward you for it!
Here, I can teach you how to make it, it's not hard.
I have one for you, enjoy.
Thank you! Here, my day’s silver, and a little something on top.
Thank you for the food, I’m full again! I’ll have the strength to finish my day’s work.
If I find what you need, I’ll be back.
Hey there, get to work! We need to turn in some iron if we want to eat tonight!
I want out of this place!
You want out? Make yourself useful, and maybe, just maybe, the guard'll let you back outside if you pay him well enough.
What do I do down here?

There's plenty of work to do to pass your time. Mine for iron scraps and give them to me, and I'll give you silver for your work. Or you can ask the guard, and if you're nice, he'll let you go help the cook or the medic.
If you make the guards mad at all, you should keep your head down and work hard to make them forget you're a troublemaker. Or else it's “The Hole” for you!
Just don't get in my way when the violence starts.
I won't. I have no interest in being thrown down "The Hole" like everyone else who tries to fight.
You're as bad as the bandits if you're working with them!
Hey now, you won't ever get out of here if you don't play along. People who cause trouble end up down "The Hole".
I’ve dug up some iron scraps, I want to be paid.
Hmm, yeah, this is quality iron. Here, your pay.
Hey, do me a solid and bring me another pickaxe would you? This one’s about to break.
Hey thanks. Here, I found some pearlbird eggs the other day, have one. You need to eat healthy if you wanna survive in here.
I think this one’s going to last for a good day or two. Hopefully I can find enough iron that I buy my way out of this damn pit...
I can't take this place anymore. I want out. I need out. My shiv’s broken... I need a new one. Bring me one and I can show you how to use it. I don’t care if you have to make one, I need one.
Here’s your shiv. What’s your plan?
This is what I need. A promise is a promise. Listen, if you need something from someone here... Backstabbing someone with one of these isn't too hard, here, let me show you...
Now leave me alone. I need to escape.
Hey! Get to work! If you don’t work, you don’t get paid. Without pay, you can’t buy food!
Hah, you want to leave! Aren’t there some errands you can do around here? Be useful to us and we can talk again about your freedom.
Well, I could always use some more coins to buy myself a drink... How much is your freedom worth?
I’ve got 30 silver for you.
I suppose that'll do. Alright, into the sack, prisoner. You'll be carted out hidden with today's corpses. Don't make a peep and you'll get out alive.
I don’t have much money...
Pah, you think that measly pile of silver is going to convince me? Get back to work, slacker, before I discipline you or throw you down “The Hole”! You’re not getting out for anything less than 30!
Is there other work I can do aside from mining?
Yeah, the cook and medic could use a hand. Go on through. But if you put one toe out of line, we'll drag you back here and teach you a lesson.
Let me out or you die.
I love it when you slaves say that. Everyone, gather 'round! Come see what happens if you cause trouble!
I'm hungry.
If you need something to drink, there's a pool of water just over there. Meals are 5 silver. Get to work before you starve!
I’ll pay 5 silver for dinner.
Enjoy your meal, prisoner. If you behave yourself, I can let you into the hallway just outside. Then, you can make your own food in the kitchen and drink clean water from the barrel on the left.
I don't have enough...
Then you'd better get to work, if you don't want to starve.
What are you doing out of the pen, prisoner?
What can I do to help you?
I need someone to cook meals for the warriors. Bring me nine meat stews as soon as humanly possible. Here, the ingredients. Use the stove to my left.
I think I lost the ingredients...
Then you're a thief. Do you know what we do to thieves in here? Guards!
Here are your stews.
Good. Say, you must be hungry. Here, your dinner, prisoner.
We don’t need any more food for today, shoo!
Where are my meat stews?
You’d better have a good excuse, prisoner!
Oy, you. You know how to make bandages, right? We need medical supplies to patch our men up. Bandages or Health Potions will do.
You know how to make them, right? You mix water, Blood Mushroom and a Gravel Beetle. I have a fellow whose life depends on one!
I have a bandage for you.
Good work. Here, you deserve a little pay.
I made the potion for you.
Damn, it’s not bad either. I think you might have saved someone’s life, prisoner. We’re grateful.
Halt, state your business!
Hi, Nindiria. I am back from scouting Cierzo, let me in, yes?
I hope you brought good news. Go make your report to Captain Rospa right away! He has moved to the training room, go left, then right, then up the stairs.
You think I’m stupid, prijpi-brain? I remember you from just a minute ago! You are clearly a spy! Do you know what we do to spies here in Vendavel?
I need to speak with your leaders immediately. I would like to join your crew.
Balira, the mage of winds, will see if you are trustworthy. Go right, then up the stairs and elevator. If you do not impress her, we will find suitable work for you!
I’m just passing by, sorry, I’ll leave.
Taspo, yes, go. Before I change my mind. Forget you saw anything.
Hey! I remember you! You’re that troublemaker! How did you get out of the prison? Guards!
You are not one of us! Get out of here before I lock you up!
(This is “The Hole” that the guards likely toss troublemakers down... You think you can hear the faint sound of water at the bottom.)
(I should be careful not to fall in.)
(Maybe I can jump down this pit to escape!)
Hol’ it right there, [PlayerName]! Some dirty rat has don’ sabotaged our Water Purifier! If you little nipper wanna get some’ to drink, boil that stinkin’ water first!
That lil’ saboteur smashed out the purifier’s Power Coils. Those were some fancy-schmancy magic parts right there! Won’t be able to get my hands on those.
Look, nipper, if ya’ find 2 Power Coils during your big ol’ adventure, can ya bring em’ here? I’ll fix my machine right up, and she’ll be purrin’ and pumpin’ in no time!
I found some Power Coils, Etios. Can you fix the machine?
[PlayerName], you done us good, nipper! It’ll take me a second to get ol’ Bess runnin’ again! And I’ll tinker you a reward with the ol’ coils from the machine.
You've been out into the swamp recently, haven't you? I've been waiting on a friend of mine to come from a trip to Harmattan, and he is overdue by several days. Have you seen him along the way?
I don’t think so, what does he look like?
He’s a plain looking missionary, and often wears a hood. I wish I could give you more to go on, but he’s your typical, quiet, unassuming type of person.
He would have come via the Chersonese, so if he’s out in the swamp, he should be taking the Pilgrim Road, and following the glowing sigils. If you find him, please let me know, eh?
Any luck finding my missing friend?
No, nothing yet, sorry.
I found a dead Missionary carrying a letter signed by you.
I found a dead Missionary along the road, but I couldn’t identify them.
Show me the letter... I was afraid of that. Yes, that was him.
Then I can only assume the worst.
Is there anything else you can tell me about the scene of the attack?
It was beside a campsite, with three bedrolls

So, he must have come with two others. I can only hope that at least one of them made it to Monsoon safely. My guess is that his companions were Amalie and Alemmon, both were supposed to come home sometime this month.
